summary:
The position works on a daily basis with the Ole Miss Athletics leadership team.
The duties of the position include preparing and reviewing business and…
job_description:
Note for Current UM Employees
Current employees must apply internally via connectU > connectu.olemiss.edu
Definition of Class
The University of Mississippi seeks an Associate General Counsel to work on athletics-related legal matters for the Ole Miss Athletics Department. The position works on a daily basis with the Ole Miss Athletics leadership team. The duties of the position include preparing and reviewing business and employment contracts, advising on personnel and student-athlete issues, advising on compliance issues, and responding to public records requests. The position reports to the university’s general counsel but is located in the athletics administration building.
This position performs duties in representing the legal interests of the University by providing legal support and guidance to University Senior leadership, staff, and faculty on all aspects of the University’s operations. The incumbent makes decisions concerning the proper response to legal inquiries from University clients and responds to requests from individuals outside the University related to legal issues.
Examples of Work Performed
Provides advice and counsel on various legal, regulatory, compliance, and administrative matters, including, but not limited to, procurement, commercial transactions, ethics, governance, academic research and copyright, data privacy, intellectual property, academic freedom, investments, conflicts of interest, licensing, and employment law.
Identifies and analyzes potential legal and compliance issues in different courses of action under consideration by the University.
Assists with the resolution of regulatory, administrative, or legal proceedings before local, federal, and state agencies and courts.
Reviews proposed offers of settlement for litigated and non-litigated matters.
Collaborates with University officials, offices, and departments to provide legal education and support.
Analyzes and interprets University policy and procedures.
Negotiates, drafts, and reviews contracts.
Conducts internal investigations and risk assessments.
Develops training materials and conducts training sessions for University employees, faculty and/or staff.
Conducts legal research.
Drafts memoranda, legal opinions, discovery requests, correspondence, and other attorney work product.
Responds to requests for public records, discovery, subpoenas, and other requests for information.
Supervises and collaborates with outside counsel as needed.
Performs similar or related duties as assigned by the Chief Legal Officer and General Counsel.
Essential Functions
These essential functions include, but are not limited to, the following. Additional essential functions may be identified and included by the hiring department.
Leverages exemplary legal writing, research, and analytical skills to provide legal advice and counsel to multiple University constituents.
Safeguards the University’s institutional and academic interests by ensuring that actions taken by or on the behalf of the University comply with University policy, federal, state, and local law or regulation.
Effectively manages multiple legal matters with competing and overlapping deadlines.
Proactively analyzes and recommends corrective action to ameliorate risk.
Minimum Education/Experience
Juris Doctorate Degree from a law school accredited by the American Bar Association, member of the Mississippi Bar Association, or obtain admission into the Mississippi Bar within 6 months of employment.
AND
Experience:
Seven (7) years of experience related to the above described duties.
Salary/Wage Information
To learn more about our pay structure and view our salary ranges, click here to visit the Compensation page of our Human Resources website. This link is provided for general pay information. Hourly rate or salary may vary depending on qualifications, experience, and departmental budget. Note: Unclassified positions (faculty, executives, researchers and coaches) do not have established salary ranges.
EEO Statement
The University of Mississippi provides equal opportunity in any employment practice, education program, or education activity to all qualified persons. The University complies with all applicable laws regarding equal opportunity and affirmative action and does not unlawfully discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based upon race, color, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, citizenship, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or genetic information.
Background Check Statement
The University of Mississippi is committed to providing a safe campus community. UM conducts background investigations for applicants being considered for employment. Background investigations include a criminal history record check, and when appropriate, a financial (credit) report or driving history check.

summary: Three years of administrative support experience, including two years equivalent to the intermediate level or one year equivalent to the experienced level.
job_description:
Job Description
This position is located in the Business Office Mailroom at Women's Huron Valley Correctional. It performs a variety of duties related to processing facility mail as well as other Business Office activities. This is a lead worker position responsible for processing all incoming and outgoing mail for the WHV complex, both staff and inmate mail, processing incoming and outgoing inmate mail encompasses screening the mail (both paper and electronic) for contraband, suspicious/questionable communications and unauthorized fund deposits. The position is also responsible for sorting and distributing all internal mail, metering postage, and writing mail rejection notices when appropriate. As the lead worker, the incumbent is responsible for coordinating the workflow of the mail room, issuing assignments, determining priorities, and ensuring that the work is completed timely, efficiently, and in compliance with policy and procedures. WHV is a multi-level female correctional facility with over 2000 beds.
Required Education and Experience
Education
Educational level typically acquired through completion of high school.

Experience
Three years of administrative support experience, including two years equivalent to the intermediate level or one year equivalent to the experienced level.
Additional Requirements and Information
Certain positions may require a criminal history background check.

summary: The mechanical development engineer will interact with other key engineering teams such as silicon design, board engineering, board validation, and…
job_description:
What you do at AMD changes everything
At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.
Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.
Mechanical Development Engineer, DCGAP Thermal Mechanical Engineering

THE ROLE:
As a Mechanical Development Engineer in the Data Center GPU and Accelerated Processing (DCGAP) Thermal Mechanical Engineering team, you will be responsible for the mechanical design and development of AMD’s Data Center GPU products in this expanding and strategic market for AMD. In addition, you will also perform mechanical design of the testing and validation products at a chip module, card, and system-level. The mechanical development engineer will interact with other key engineering teams such as silicon design, board engineering, board validation, and manufacturing as well as leaders within AMD, our customers, and our partners.

THE PERSON:
The Mechanical Development Engineer in the team will have excellent communication skills, planning skills, mechanical design skills, possesses critical problem solving and trouble shooting skills. They will need to be comfortable in a fast paced and multi-tasking environment.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

You will:
Be responsible for the end-to-end development and delivery of mechanical solutions for the GPU and advanced processing products and supporting hardware.
Integrate into a global development team in delivering commercially viable products (silicon to systems) to the marketplace in a timely and cost-effective manner.
Be a driver of continuous improvement and new ways of thinking by promoting new ideas/perspectives around mechanical design.
The main areas of focus will be:
Product Design of graphics processing unit mechanical solutions, including 3D modelling, FEA, and CAD design to meet or exceed the product requirements and schedule with an eye towards cost optimizations and industrial design considerations.
Characterization products through prototyping, test, and analysis. This includes creating test plans for mechanical analysis, compliance testing, and optimization at a card-level and customer/reference system-level.
Technology Development from the chip-level to the system-level to constantly drive innovation and push the boundaries of electronics cooling and productize leading edge technology for volume manufacturing.
REQUIREMENTS:
Communication, Teamwork, and Problem Solving - Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Computer Added Design – CAD experience required. Experience with SolidWorks and/or Creo is preferred
Finite Element Analysis - FEA experience a plus. FEA with ANSYS a plus
Lab Skills - Experience with Design of Experiments, instrumentation, data acquisition and data analysis, including uncertainty analysis
Manufacturing - Knowledge of Design for Manufacturing (DFM) and tolerance analysis
Teamwork - Effective collaboration within a team structure. Multidisciplinary experience is a plus
PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
The Mechanical Engineer in Thermal Mechanical Engineering must have demonstrated the understanding of mechanical engineering concepts, coursework, and design related experience. Our selected candidate will use his/her skills to ensure the engineering team continuously innovates, uses ‘best practices’, and adds value for its customers thought sound mechanical engineering design.

ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:
BS in Mechanical Engineering and + 0-3 years of experience. Concentration in CAD and structural design preferred. MS in Mechanical Engineering a plus.

Austin, Texas

job_description:
Position Description: Cashier/Receptionist


Reports to: Service Manager/Controller


Position Information: The Cashier/Receptionist is responsible for the receipt of payment from customers and employees in payment for goods or services, and accurately records the amounts received. Must present a professional, friendly image. Perform general clerical duties. Provides general office support with a variety of clerical activities and related tasks. The receptionist will be responsible for answering incoming calls, directing calls to appropriate associates, mail distribution, flow of correspondence, requisition of supplies as well as additional clerical duties.


Position Responsibilities:


Receive cash, checks and credit card payments from customers and record amount received.
Flag and close repair orders.
Make change and issue receipts to customers.
Responsible for daily cash reconciliation.
Refer customers who have additional questions to the service consultant or other appropriate individual.
Handle customer complaints with integrity and poise and escort or refer the customer to the appropriate individual for further communication.
Perform general clerical duties.
Attend training classes as directed by supervisor.
Follow policies and procedures as set forth in Employee Handbook.
Answers incoming calls and directs the caller to the appropriate person, if asked for by name, or department.
Communicates with callers in a professional, courteous and efficient manner, minimizing the time a caller is put on hold. Informs caller if there is no answer, requesting if they would like voice mail.
Takes messages, if requested by the caller, including full name, time of call, reason for call and return number. Communicate messages to the appropriate party in a timely manner.
For general inquires, provides callers with information such as company address, directions to the company location, company fax numbers, company website, and other related information.
Updated and distributes company telephone roster.
Greets and directs visitors to the company.
Provides callers with information such as company address, directions to the company location, company fax numbers, company website, and other related information.
Receives, sorts and forwards incoming mail. Maintains and routes publications.
Coordinates the pick-up and delivery of express mail services (FedEx, UPS, etc.)
May also assist with other related clerical duties such as photocopying, faxing, filing and collating.
Any other duties as assigned.


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:


Educational: High school diploma or the equivalent preferred; or six months to one year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.


Special Skills (i.e., licenses, certifications, etc.): Excellent oral communication skills. Ability to read and comprehend instructions and information. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, employees and the general public. Ability to work well with customers. General math skills. Ability to use personal computer applications including word processing, spreadsheet applications and company software. Ability to operate office equipment. Skill and ability to organize and prioritize work and meet deadlines.


Physical Demands and Working Conditions:


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, use hands to finger, handle, or feel and use a computer. Frequently works on a computer or doing other “close vision” work. Finger and hand dexterity required to operate a cash register and handle cash. The employee frequently is required to talk, hear and reach with hands and arms. Occasionally requires the ability to lift 20 pounds of material.

job_description:
JOB SUMMARY: Supervises the day-day monitoring, treatment and maintenance of pools, storm water conveyance systems, fountains, and attraction ride water across property. Conducts water chemistry evaluations, management of chemical inventories, servicing motors, pumps, valves, filters, and electronic sensing, recording and control equipment. Oversees preventative maintenance for all pool water treatment related equipment. Supervises storm water conveyance system cleaning. Ensures calibration of fixed and portable measurement instruments as needed. Participates in the hiring, training and scheduling of team members for work areas. Schedules and facilitates all water sampling for pools, fountains, and attraction ride water as required.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

Supervises water quality department shift startup and turnover, inspections and chemical control procedures to include: scheduling of preventative maintenance for water quality equipment rooms, laboratory and maintenance areas. Review of work area checklists and water data from measuring instruments. Responds to resolve interruptions in storm water service and changing chemical, biological, and physical conditions of pools and water special effects ensuring acceptable water quality at all times. Ensure storm water conveyance systems are clear and operational.
Responsible for the maintenance of all water treatment equipment including but not limited to chlorinators, filters, pumps, motors, gas injectors, valves, and ultra violet light systems. Keeps pools clean and sanitary at all times.
Interfaces with various departments on a daily basis to ensure delivery of quality product and service.
Plans and schedules work areas, which includes managing work orders as well as parts procurement.
Participates in budgetary responsibilities for water quality. Establishes and executes a P.M. program to keep equipment calibrated and operational.
Maintains records of all water chemistry monitoring data. Communicates data to Water Quality Manager.
Trains, develops, and schedules all water quality team members by administering Universal Orlando policies and procedures, to include disciplinary action, counseling, attendance tracking, hiring and performing staffing selections.
Understands and actively participates in Environmental, Health & Safety responsibilities by following established UO policy, procedures, training and team member involvement activities.
Performs other duties as assigned.

SCOPE:

Responsible for facilitating a team oriented atmosphere for technicians that ensures success and positive interactions.
Facilitate team ownership of projects producing project excellence through effective collaboration.
Conduct routine inspection of all technician assigned work areas throughout property. Ensure all documentation maintenance and water testing is complete and accurate.
Responsible for resolving technical water chemistry and equipment problems using experience or outside resources.
Conduct maintenance of storm water system with contractor. Ensure system is clean and flowing properly at all times. Work with facility maintenance department to ensure storm grates and piping are in good working order and not a trip hazard.
Accompany regulatory agencies during inspections.
Responsible for ensuring appropriate general UO policies are applied to frequently changing situations.
Train newly hired technicians on SOP’s, equipment maintenance and water testing requirements.
Review of existing equipment and development of preventative maintenance timelines and schedules based on manufacturer’s recommendations or trending equipment failure rates.
Assist with communications and partnerships with various departments to ensure success of projects involving water quality.
Responsible for pool cleaning including pool surfaces, grates, strainers, skimmers and algae control.
Ensure verification of automatic chemical controllers and field test kits compared to bench top lab equipment.
Ensure routine maintenance and housekeeping tasks are assigned to technicians in a fair and equitable manner.
Responds and coordinates resources in a timely manner to client concerns and requests for service of pools, interactive water features, fountains and ponds and ensure client expectations are exceeded.

EDUCATION:

High school degree or GED is required.
Technical school is required.
Associate’s degree (AA) or Bachelor’s degree is preferred.

EXPERIENCE: 5-7 years of technical and trade experience in either electrical controls, plumbing or mechanical fields in an industrial setting OR direct supervision of water-park maintenance operations OR direct supervision of water plant maintenance operations is required.

CERTIFICATIONS, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS: Must acquire an Aquatic Facility Operator certification or equivalent within 6 months of hire. FDEP SOP Sampling training for groundwater, surface water, and waste water.

Your talent, skills and experience will be rewarded with a competitive compensation package.

job_description:
LOCATION: Denver, Colorado (US-CO)
JOB NUMBER: 66482
ANNUAL COMPENSATION RANGE: $190,000 - $230,000 (salary + target bonus) (Range does not include value of additional equity offered with role)
Why you should join us:
Are you looking for a role where you get to work on cutting-edge environmental, climate, regulatory, and policy issues with the opportunity to develop in other areas of the law as part of a high-performing, collaborative in-house legal team, then we have the opportunity for you!
Our U.S. Legal Team, based in Denver, is seeking a talented lawyer to join us in a diverse and dynamic role that will have an environmental focus with additional exposure to other legal areas in serving as a trusted legal and commercial advisor for one of North America’s leading energy companies.
You will use your expertise to:
Provide legal advice and support for our U.S. businesses and U.S. Environmental, Health, and Safety team covering a broad range of environmental, climate, sustainability, safety, and regulatory issues
Work with state and federal regulatory agencies and support regulatory rulemakings
Support legislative policy development
Manage and oversee litigation
Offer legal expertise to emergency response situations and incident investigations
Develop expertise and provide legal support for employment, labor, and privacy matters
Provide advice on various legislative and regulatory requirements
Proactively identify and manage areas of legal risk, including bringing expertise to bear in supporting commercial transactions, real property issues, construction projects, and business processes
We’d like to review your application if you have…
Must-haves (minimum requirements):
Juris Doctor degree from an ABA accredited law school
5 to 10 years of practicing law with experience in environmental or regulatory work
At least 5 years of law firm/private practice experience preferred
Licensed to practice law in the State of Colorado in good standing
Excellent written work product, research, analytical skills, and oral advocacy skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; high emotional intelligence
The ability to work collaboratively with diverse teams
Agile and creative thinker; ability to synthesize a wide range of principles, issues, needs and outcomes; ability to learn new or emerging areas of the law; ability to find practical solutions while balancing legal, commercial, operational, and other parameters
Values diversity and inclusion
Positive attitude, self-directed, and ability to both work independently and lead cross-functional teams
Demonstrated community involvement and diversity of outside interests
Alignment with our values: safety above all else, stronger together, operational discipline, curiosity and lifelong learning, and act with integrity
Where you’ll be working, your work schedule, and other important information:
U.S. Legal Team is currently working 100% remote
In mid-2022, plan to transition to hybrid working environment; mix of in-office and remote
Future legal offices to be in our LEED Silver business center building in Commerce City, CO
Hours of work are a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday, with the potential for extended work hours based on business needs
We have numerous Employee Inclusion Networks who work together to help foster an inclusive and respectful culture and drive positive change at Suncor. The U.S. downstream business also includes a crude oil pipeline business and a retail business.
Our global presence offers rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute, and grow in a variety of career-building positions. Executes Change Control, Engineering trials and lab studies and Authors associated technical reports in support of packaging engineering / process trials and studies.
Author, Proofread, Approve and Maintain package and label specifications and bills of material for package container/closure systems and secondary packaging components.
Interface and represent site capabilities and competencies in support of the Package Design and Development departments of the Pfizer McPherson plant development of new packages and/or changes to existing packages.
Serve as subject matter expert for component equipment interfaces and capabilities ensuring that package designs and systems will operate efficiently on existing and new packaging lines. It is the responsibility of the package engineer to ensure package components are designed properly to run on existing or new packaging lines with Pfizer of Pfizer contract manufacturers.
Work collaboratively with Global Technical Services (GTS) Package Technology, Package Testing and Technology and Supply Chain and Procurement teams to support packaging and component projects.
Serve as subject matter expert for SAP activities related to Master Recipes and Bills of Material.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
BS or Higher in Engineering or Science required with 0-1 years of experience in a pharmaceutical manufacturing site.

Knowledge:
Familiarity or expertise with packaging equipment and industry standards must be demonstrated. Experience with secondary packaging and labeling requirements for FDA regulated products desirable. Competency in PC software such as MS Word, Excel and Project is necessary
Must be familiar with all aspects of package development and packaging operations.

Experience:
Packaging engineering experience or equivalent experience in packaging or manufacturing environment preferred. The ideal candidate will have experience in the pharmaceutical or consumer healthcare industries and have a working knowledge of business procedures required to adequately perform minimal job functions.
Must possess excellent communication skills coupled with a self-starter attitude, have demonstrated problem solving abilities and resolve to get tasks accomplished, project and task management skills, an ability to manage priorities while working under pressure and aggressive time constraints
Ability to work with minimal supervision.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Packaging engineering experience or equivalent experience in packaging or manufacturing environment preferred.
Experience with secondary packaging and labeling requirements for FDA regulated products preferred.
SAP experience.

Able to climb ladders/steps
Able to lift items of up to 25 lbs

Remains organized & positive in ambiguous and fast-paced, rapidly changing situations
Ability to analyze data from detailed schedule and risk management tools
Interface effectively with multiple stakeholder groups
Ability to appropriately manage ambiguity and work autonomously

job_description:
Company Description
It takes a lot of very smart, hard-working and talented people to provide the level of care that we give to our patients. Tufts Medical Center is an internationally respected academic medical center and we pride ourselves not only on the sophistication of the care we deliver, but the compassionate way in which we provide it. And that starts with our employees.

Job Description
This position is responsible for performing cleaning duties for Tremont Street Garage with cashiering responsibilities as needed.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Cleans garage, office, stairwells, and elevators.
Removes debris such as loose paper, cans and bottles throughout garage area and stairwells.
Empties trash receptacles in garage, office, bathrooms, and replaces with fresh bags.
Using cleaning solvents, cleans bathrooms including sinks and commodes. Replenishes supplies (toilet paper, paper towels, and soap) as necessary.
Using gas powered sweeper, sweeps and cleans front entrance area of garage.
Cleans elevators by shining chrome, spraying walls and washing floors.
Collects parking tickets and refunds appropriate change especialy during peak periods.
Answers garage patrons' requests for information courteously.
Performs other related duties when requested by supervisor

Qualifications
JOB KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
Ability to read, write, count and speak basic English, as well as follow basic instructions.
Ability to drive and operate sweeper machine.
Ability to operate cash register and count money: Attention to detail necessary when handling money and giving change.
EDUCATION:
High School diploma or GED preferred.
EXPERIENCE:
One to two months on the job training.
An equivalent combination of education and experience which provides proficiency in the areas of responsibility listed above may be substituted for the above education and experience requirements.
WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
Exposure to all types of weather conditions, dirt and dust.
Contact with Medical Center staff and general public.
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES STATEMENT:
Must be able to perform all essential functions of this position with reasonable accommodation if disabled.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed, as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. Tufts Medical Center reserves the right to modify position duties at any time, to reflect process improvements and business necessity.

Please note that effective October 1, 2021, as a condition of employment at Tufts Medical Center, all employees and new hires must have received their complete dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, unless they have been granted an exemption.

summary: Therefore, the manager’s daily work can range from sitting in on creative UX design explorations, to listening in to Consumer Insights focus group sessions, to…
job_description:
Remote, United States
Creative Production
Location: CA preferred, open to Remote
At Netflix, innovation is in our DNA and one way this shows up is through continuous improvements to the service for our members / non-members. These improvements can span ideas like promotional tactics that help people to discover their new favorite show, new ways to enjoy content, or testing what the right trailer or piece of artwork will be for that member to press ‘play’.
We are seeking an experienced people leader who is passionate about bringing teams together and excels in a fast-paced product innovation organization. This small but critical team is comprised of seasoned program managers who leverage their deep knowledge of the production, operations and delivery of content & promotional assets to partner with our Engineering, Product Management, Design and other teams within Netflix to develop, execute and deliver on A/B testing and other innovation initiatives.
Our team leader will focus on building partnerships with direct reports and with peer teams, including Editorial Creative, Product Studio, Creative Strategy, Globalization and Operations teams. These partnerships ensure our larger organization’s work is delivered through timely and high quality implementation in the product. As a member of the Creative Production team, the Program Manager focuses on the metadata, textual, visual and motion assets artistically created within CP. Therefore, the manager’s daily work can range from sitting in on creative UX design explorations, to listening in to Consumer Insights focus group sessions, to ideating and delivering alongside UI and data science engineering teams, to consulting on next steps given the statistical results of the last A/B test - all in a collective effort to consistently deliver a premium, delightful experience to our growing domestic and international member base.
In this role you will:
Lead a team of program managers to consistently execute innovation projects with stellar craftsmanship
Manage and allocate team resources based on business priorities to optimize the values the team can deliver to the business
Build strong partnership with Product Managers, Product Engineering, Product Design, Data Science and other key cross functional stakeholders and represent Creative Production in cross functional forums
Collaborate with peer leaders in Creative Production, Product Innovation, Product Design, and Product Engineering, to ensure alignment and timely delivery on organizational priorities
Identify opportunities to increase the value our program management team can add to Creative Production and Netflix. Drive and implement change.
Develop talent and skills with the team to meet evolving business needs and advocate for the team
Identify opportunities for increased efficiencies and collaborations with partners, focusing on optimizing impact within the organization or on our consumer base
Lead the planning and execution of innovation programs and A/B tests for the global Netflix product that requires the building of new metadata and data schemas; textual, visual or motion assets; or asset workflows
Advise and consult with individual program managers on implementation of projects and programs and engagement with stakeholders
Occasional travel is required between our California headquarters and other satellite offices once we resume in-person work
We seek a passionate leader who:
Possesses deep experience managing complex local and global cross functional programs in a fast-pace environment where technology intersects with creativity
Possesses deep domain expertise and working knowledge in establishing and implementing program management frameworks and best practices
Understands change management and be able to adapt and apply that knowledge to drive sustainable change across multiple teams and stakeholders with diverse backgrounds and priorities
Possesses excellent EQ with an empathetic communication style that fosters connection, collaboration and motivation
Demonstrates confidence to rely on self-judgment and take smart risks, and a history of developing the same within a team
Is a strategic thinker who can look around the corner to identify areas of opportunities within the team and across the organization based on data / feedback and observations
Can switch between being strategic and tactical seamlessly and can connect the dots between the 30,000 fit view of the company / product strategy and the work of the team
Possesses a high business acumen and proven ability to plan proactively, react quickly when challenges arise, while retaining a laser focus on making business impact
Has a healthy technical literacy and aptitude to apply algorithmic, qualitative and quantitative data in decision-making
Thrives in a fast-changing work environment where ambiguity is seen as opportunities
Exhibits humility and is astonishingly objective and nonpolitical when it comes to working with people
Is a quick learner who relies on strong critical and analytical thinking skills
Insists on providing constructive, direct feedback in a mature and respectful manner
Has the ability to embody the Netflix values and places the health of the organization at the forefront when building and supporting the team
APPLY NOW

job_description:
Job Description:

For more than 25 years, Asurion has been a leader in innovation, not only in the tech solutions industry, but in creating a culture where employees feel valued.
We help people do more with their technology and stay connected on all of their devices. We provide our customers with simple, helpful advice to get the most from their technology, assistance to fix any technology issues they have and protection of their devices to ensure they quickly get a replacement or repair if anything does go wrong.
What you will be doing
The Technology Logistics Center (TLC) Supervisor is responsible for organizing and directing the daily activities of the TLC Operation. The main responsibility of a TLC Supervisor is to manage, develop and guide operational employees to ensure their ability to provide outstanding results and execute tasks effectively. Supervisors will also be accountable for ensuring employees are meeting quality standards as they relate to the operational work standards and calculating performance metrics.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Shift Time: Monday-Friday, 8am-5pm
Evaluate Staffing Levels to ensure that safety, quality and production plans are met.
Ensure training is complete for new and existing employees to process updates and changes.
Review and Evaluate teams daily to ensure processes and accountability measures are in place.
Conduct monthly 1x1 discussions/performance reviews with employees to ensure they understand current and future targets.
Collaborate with your team and peers on continuous improvement activities and efforts across the department and ensure that continuous improvement is being conducted.
Exposure/Experience with Lean Concepts (PDCA, Kaizen, Point Kaizen, MDI and Root Cause Analysis).
Review Operational Work Instructions to make sure that your department is compliant.
Lead team meetings to provide information about daily targets, process and procedure updates, company news and any additional information that is pertinent for employees to complete their job.
Meet or Exceed inventory accuracy metrics for your department.
Promote and Adhere to Asurion Core Values daily for self and team.
Promote and Adhere to the Employee Handbook daily for self and team.
Compile reports regarding your department’s activities to ensure that your daily plan matches what is needed.
Ensure daily targets to internal and external customers are met daily.
Ensure request from Global/Local HR request are completed on time (compliance courses, workday and etc).
Ensure Payroll systems are accurate and updated daily.
Ensure internal departmental databases are updated daily.
Coach, mentor and develop employees to meet Asurion’s expectations for productivity, quality, and goal accomplishments.
Work with COEs to recruit, interview, select and hire employees into functional area.
Provides oversight and direction to the employees in the functional area in accordance with the Asurion's policies and procedures.
OTHER FUNCTIONS. Other duties as assigned.
Here’s what you’ll bring to the team:
Skills/knowledge:
Demonstrate the ability to understand and apply problem solving techniques in day to day activities.
High energy level, detail oriented, exhibit a sense of urgency and initiative to perform in a fast paced environment.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Must be able to work with a well diverse teams.
Computer skills in Microsoft Office Suite.
Must be able to multi-task within a fast paced environment.
Respect core values of Asurion and comply with the Company's policies and procedures.
Experience/education:
4 year degree or equivalent leadership experience.
Experience with Warehouse Management Systems.
Warehouse/Manufacturing Experience.
Physical demands: Bending, sitting, lifting, and standing based on the need of the business. Standing and/or sitting for extended and long periods of time, up to 100% of shift or over time.
Work environment:
Specific vision abilities that may be required by this job including close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. Vocal communications is required for expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word and/or to communicate with customers and/or clients. Hearing is required to perceive information at normal spoken word levels and in environment with loud machinery.
Exposure to heat, cold, dust, noise, chemicals, and such matters as demands for overtime or shift work. Exposure to various materials including cardboard, various metals and plastics. Exposure to moving equipment and objects in the immediate work area such as automated machinery, fulfillment line, heavily laden carts, and forklifts. Exposure to tools or material with sharp edges which may involve the risk of injury.
We take care of you (benefits/perks):
Competitive pay and benefits including health, dental, and vision
Retirement savings plan
Paid time off
Continuing education support
Ongoing training to grow your skills
a

About Asurion
At Asurion, every one of us is a leader, from individual contributors to the senior team. We utilize our 5 Leadership Principles to help align and guide us in our everyday interactions.
Put Customers First
Play A Team Sport
Take Ownership

summary:
Area: Programs for Young Leaders and Alumni Relations.
Reports to: Manager, Rotary Programs for Young Leaders & Alumni Relations.
You Will Be Responsible For.
job_description:
Job Title: Youth Exchange and Youth Protection Supervisor
Area: Programs for Young Leaders and Alumni Relations
Reports to: Manager, Rotary Programs for Young Leaders & Alumni Relations
Classification: Exempt
Location: Evanston, IL
(Currently working remote but will return to office - must be willing to relocate or currently live in the Chicagoland area)

Organization Overview
Rotary is a membership organization that unites people from all continents and cultures who take action to deliver real, long-term solutions to pressing issues facing our communities and the world. Each year, Rotary members expand their networks, build lasting relationships, and invest more than $200 million and 16 million volunteer hours to improve lives and create positive change in the world. In exchange for hard work and dedication in support of Rotary’s clubs, members and other participants, and their humanitarian service projects, our employees receive competitive salaries, flexible schedules, comprehensive benefits, and job enrichment. To learn more, visit http://www.rotary.org.

Rotary’s Commitment to Diversity
As a global network that strives to build a world where people unite and take action to create lasting change, Rotary values diversity and celebrates the contributions of people of all backgrounds, regardless of their age, ethnicity, race, color, abilities, religion, socioeconomic status, culture, sex, sexual orientation, and gender identity.
General Overview
Manages all Youth Exchange activities, including the certification program for minimum standards in program administration and development of Youth Exchange program and alumni engagement strategy. Supervises section personnel. Serves as Associate Youth Protection Officer for the association to foster safe environments for youth, manage incidents, and mitigate risk.
You Will Have
Required: Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent), with international experience preferred
Preferred: Master’s degree
Minimum of five years’ experience in youth programming, service-learning preferred, or administration of international organizations.
Previous supervisory experience preferred.
Past experience in education abroad field helpful.
Experience with content development helpful.
Certification or education in crisis counseling, social work, and/or child abuse prevention preferred.
Previous work experience with an international non-government organization (NGO), or training or membership associations helpful.

You Are Good At
Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills to effectively interact with colleagues, senior volunteers and other external contacts.
Strong supervisory skills, including ability to delegate, motivate, and evaluate performance.
Ability to strategically plan and forecast with regard to budget and program management.
Project management experience - must be able to develop processes, manage multiple priorities, and work under time constraints with autonomy within project parameters.
Firm commitment to provide excellent customer service to internal/external contacts.
Competence in reading, analyzing, and processing a high volume of documents containing technical language in areas of youth protection, risk management, and law.
Mastery of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Adobe.
High attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.
Initiative and creativity highly valued.
Collaborative and creative approach to quickly developing solutions and managing change in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work in a volunteer-led organization.
Ability to deliver professional presentations to Rotary volunteer leaders at all levels.
Ability to adapt to a changing environment.
Multicultural experience preferred, proficiency in a second language helpful but not required.

You Are Open To
Travel
Occasional weekend speaking engagements
Responding to reports of sexual abuse and harassment involving youth

You Will Be Responsible For
Youth Exchange Program Supervision
Manages Youth Exchange program activities, leading a team providing specialized guidance and support to volunteer program officers, Rotary leaders, and the general public.
Oversees the district Youth Exchange certification program to ensure minimum standards on student safety. Conducts or oversees compliance reviews and on-site district Youth Exchange evaluations and reviews internal procedures to ensure on-going compliance and monitoring.
Directs the development of program marketing efforts, global communications, and publications (including guides, brochures, training materials, and other resources).
Youth Protection
Handles complaints related to youth protection, RI policy compliance, and other areas of concern or misconduct to ensure youth safety is the highest priority. Conducts reviews of confidential information, coordinating with risk management, legal, and media relations staff to ensure timely resolution and follow-through.
Manages the collection, storage, and use of all program and case management data to provide accurate statistical reports and ensure compliance with certification program, youth protection policies, and privacy considerations.
Implements organization-wide youth protection strategy to foster safe environments in line with RI policies. Serves as subject-matter expert on youth protection, delivering online and in-person educational resources and policy guidance to a multicultural audience on sensitive content of a technical or legal nature.
Identifies opportunities for streamlining, refining, and improving procedures, recommending or implementing changes, including the utilization of new technology, as appropriate.

Board and Committee Support
Serve as staff liaison to RI committees and resource groups for Youth Exchange, Rotary Coordinators, and preconvention events, as assigned.
Prepare board items on Youth Exchange and youth protection; ensures the implementation of all section-related board and trustee action.

Other
Cultivate and maintain relationships with other organizations that support student exchange programs or youth protection.
Represent and/or present on behalf of Youth Exchange and RI at Rotary and other public events as assigned.
Hires, trains, coaches, and appraises Program Specialists, and temporary help, as required.
Develops and monitors administrative budgets for the Youth Exchange program, including the Youth Exchange Officers Preconvention and committees, totaling approximately US$150,000 annually.
Prepares calendarization of expenses and explanation of variances for those accounts.
Other duties and special projects as assigned.

Leadership Attributes
Engagement: Promote an inclusive environment where people feel they can speak up
Presence: Demonstrate emotional intelligence
Accountability: Hold yourself and others accountable
Productivity: Maximize effectiveness by soliciting diverse ideas
Adaptability: Embrace change and help others adapt
Strategy: Anticipate trends and their impact

Why work for Rotary?
Generous medical, dental, and vision benefits package
Progressive 401k matching contributions
Above market and generous paid time off package
Tuition reimbursement
Professional development opportunities
On-site cafeteria and coffee bar with special pricing for Rotary employees
Flextime-several different work schedules to choose from
Close to CTA, Metra, a variety of stores, and many food options

job_title: newUCLA Civil Rights Office Health Investigator
summary: The incumbent's job responsibilities will include: receiving reports and complaints; conducting initial assessment, intake and preliminary investigation;…
job_description:
Under the general oversight of the Assistant Vice Chancellor for Civil Rights, and in coordination with the Staff Diversity and EEO Compliance Director, Title IX Director, and Discrimination Prevention Office Director, the incumbent is responsible for the investigation and resolution of complaints of sexual harassment, sexual violence, and discrimination and harassment based on race, color, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender expression, gender identity, gender transition status, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition (cancer-related or genetic characteristics), genetic information (including family medical history), ancestry, marital status, age, sexual orientation, citizenship, or service in the uniformed services, including protected veterans (brought by employees, students, patients or others) in the UCLA Health System and in the David Geffen School of Medicine ("DGSOM"). The incumbent will be located in the Civil Rights Office's Health Investigation Unit. The incumbent's job responsibilities will include: receiving reports and complaints; conducting initial assessment, intake and preliminary investigation; determining the appropriate process used in response to complaints (including alternative resolution and formal investigation); conducting prompt, equitable and impartial administrative investigations; making findings of fact and applying relevant policies in individual cases. The incumbent will draft and revise investigation reports. The incumbent will assist in maintaining database and records related to responses and investigations. The incumbent will assist in identifying, developing and integrating best practices and procedures into the complaint response and resolution process. The incumbent will also train UCLA Health System, and DGSOM, and UCLA employees and students regarding the interpretation of Title VI, Title VII, Title IX, the ADA, and the University's non- discrimination policies, as well as the University's obligations under these policies. The incumbent is a Campus Security Authority under the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act and a Responsible Employee under the UC Policy on Sexual Violence and Sexual Harassment and the UC Non Discrimination Policy.

Percentage of Time:
100

Shift Start:
8:00 am

Shift End:
5:00 pm

Qualifications for Position

22
Records

Qualifications

Required/Preferred

Working knowledge of federal and state regulations related to Title VI, Title VII, Title IX, ADA, and other state civil rights laws that apply to the public sector consistent with University of California policies and guidelines.

Required

Deep and broad knowledge of federal and state law pertaining to discrimination, harassment, and sexual violence. Strong knowledge of case law and employment and education law trends.

Required

Working knowledge of federal and state employment practices, procedures and laws, including performance management, corrective action, and progressive discipline including termination of employment.

Required

Ability to research, interpret and apply law and policy.

Required

Demonstrated skill in analyzing information, problems, situations, practices and/or procedures to define the problem or objective, identify relevant concerns, identify patterns and relationships, formulate logical and objective conclusions, and recognize alternatives and their implications.

Required

Demonstrated ability to write detailed, well-organized, publishable analytical reports, procedures and/or memos in a timely manner.

Required

Demonstrated skill in negotiating, exchanging ideas, information and opinions with others to formulate policies and programs and/or arrive jointly at decisions, conclusions and/or solutions.

Required

Demonstrated ability to make oral presentations to individuals or groups to enhance understanding of applicable policy or procedure in the employment and patient care contexts.

Required

Demonstrated ability to interpret and effectively explain complex policies and procedures to all levels of students, academic, and staff personnel.

Required

Demonstrated ability to quickly establish rapport and professional credibility and

to gain the trust of administrators, faculty, and staff at all levels of the University, UCLA Health System, and the DGSOM, as well as students and individuals external to UCLA.

Required

Strong skill in communicating empathetically with discrimination complainants

and respondents.

Required

Strong skill in interviewing employees, students, patients and outside constituents

concerning sensitive matters related to discrimination.

Required

Demonstrated ability in investigating complaints.

Required

Demonstrated ability to recognize an emergency situation and take appropriate action.

Required

Demonstrated ability to function as part of a team and to collaborate with colleagues to facilitate the resolution of employee and/or organizational issues.

Required

Demonstrated ability to function effectively under conditions of frequent interruptions and/or distraction, changing priorities, multiple deadlines and a frequently heavy workload.

Required

Demonstrated ability to work independently with only general direction and to accept equivocal circumstances and take appropriate action where answers to a problem are not readily apparent.

Required

Demonstrated ability to appropriately handle confidential and/or sensitive information and/or documents, including information related to collective bargaining.

Required

Ability to interact and communicate with individuals from various cultural, social, economic and educational backgrounds.

Required

Juris Doctor (JD) from an accredited American Bar Association (ABA) institution.

Preferred

Healthcare industry, higher education, and/or public sector experience.

Preferred

Experience in leading and conducting all aspects of complex workplace investigations.

Preferred

job_description:
Notes: As an employee you will enjoy generous benefits and work/life programs. For detailed information on Benefits for this position, click here.


UW Medicine includes Harborview Medical Center, UW Medical Center - Montlake, UW Medical Center - Northwest, Valley Medical Center, UW Neighborhood Clinics, UW Physicians, UW School of Medicine and Airlift Northwest. UW Medicine - Northwest is a full-service, non-profit community hospital, offering comprehensive medical, surgical and therapeutic services. With 281 beds, more than 1900 employees and a world-class medical staff, we provide innovative, technologically advanced care on a patient-friendly, easy-access campus just north of Seattle. We're proud of the acclaim we've received for our excellence in patient care and safety. Among the local, regional and national recognition we've received are: The Distinguished Hospital for Clinical Excellence Award; The Emergency Medicine Excellence Award; The Stroke Care Excellence Award; Winner of the HealthGrades Distinguished Hospital Award for Patient Safety for the last three years in a row, we’re also one of the safest places to get care – among the top 5% in the country.


UW Medical Center - Northwest has an outstanding opportunity for a DAY-SHIFT, PART-TIME (32 HOURS A WEEK), PATIENT SERVICES SUPERVISOR. The Patient Services Supervisor is responsible for supervising Patient Services Representatives and/or other assigned staff, directing and providing support services, and coordinating all patient care services including patients’ entry into and flow through the health care system.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

Assist managers and physicians to develop and implement patient care systems

Identify and plan for staffing needs and proactively takes appropriate action

Prepare employee schedules and assign work to staff; evaluate daily workload, workflow, and adjust staff assignments accordingly

Effectively delegate, manage change, set expectations and goals, make decisions, solve problems, and model fairness and respect

Build relationships and fosters teamwork and collaboration to accomplish organization’s goals

Identify quality benchmarks, assess departmental performance and design improvement plans

Develop goals and objectives and maintains policies and procedures

Develop budget and monitor/control expenses to fit budget expectations

Improve department cost efficiency and productivity

Facilitate open communications and joint decision making with staff

Interview and select staff, hires, and promotions

Evaluate staff performance and competency; coach/discipline/discharge to improve individual and departmental performance

Collaborate with management to develop departmental budget, monitors data to evaluate department productivity, maintains a cost-effective department


DESIRED:


A Bachelor’s Degree in a medically related or public relations field and one year experience in a healthcare setting which includes lead responsibility or Equivalent education/experience.


Applicants considered for this position will be required to disclose if they are the subject of any substantiated findings or current investigations related to sexual misconduct at their current employment and past employment. Disclosure is required under Washington state law.

Committed to attracting and retaining a diverse staff, the University of Washington will honor your experiences, perspectives and unique identity. Together, our community strives to create and maintain working and learning environments that are inclusive, equitable and welcoming.
The University of Washington is a leader in environmental stewardship & sustainability, and committed to becoming climate neutral.
The University of Washington is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.
To request disability accommodation in the application process, contact the Disability Services Office at 206-543-6450 or dso@uw.edu.

The employee frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls in repetitive motions. The employee is frequently required to walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms. The employee occasionally lifts and carries tubs and cases weighing up to 75 pounds. The employee must frequently communicate with expediters and servers and read orders on tickets. The employee is occasionally exposed to hazards including, but not limited to cuts from knives, slipping, tripping, falls and burns; frequent exposure to smoke, steam, high temperatures, humidity, extreme cold; frequent contact/immersion of hands in water, sanitation solutions, meat products, poultry products, seafood and produce items and frequent washing of hands.

job_description:
About NYC Health + Hospitals

NYC Health + Hospitals/Bellevue is America’s oldest public hospital, established in 1736. Affiliated with the NYU School of Medicine, the 844-bed hospital is a major referral center for highly complex cases, with its 6,000 employees including highly skilled, interdisciplinary clinical staff. It sees more than 110,000 emergency room visits and 500,000 outpatient visits annually. Bellevue is an academic medical institution of international renown. We have served as an incubator for major innovations in public health, medical science, and medical education. Bellevue is a Level I Trauma Center delivering around-the-clock care in adult, pediatric, psychiatric and pediatric psychiatric emergencies as well as in the nationally-designated categories of cardiology, neurology, toxicology, and neonatology. In addition to providing comprehensive inpatient and outpatient state-of-the-art care Bellevue is a city-wide medical specialty referral source. Bellevue’s clinical centers of excellence include: Emergency Medicine and Trauma Care; Cardiovascular Services; Designated Regional Perinatal Center and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (ICU); Comprehensive Children’s Psychiatric Emergency Program; and Cancer Services.

Job Description

Under general direction supervises the daily operation of the Pathology Department Central Supply Room.
Example of Typical Tasks:
I. MANAGEMENT OF STAFF:
Supervises and assigns work to subordinate employees. Establishes work hours employees (including breaks, lunches, and necessary overtime). Assigns responsibilities and monitors their work.
Performance Criteria:
a. Defines the expected outcome and time of completion clearly to staff.
b. Communicates the objective of the assignment to the employee.
c. Assigns work in order to accomplish goals in timely fashion.
d. Reviews/initials daily work
e. Solicits feedback from the employee to ensure the assignment is understood.
II. STAFF EVALUATION, COUNSELING AND PERSONNEL RELATED ACTIVITIES:
Supervises the Store Room staff. Evaluates and documents staff performance, performs personnel counseling with the assistance of the Administrative Director of Pathology.
Performance Criteria:
a. Performs staff evaluation and offer recommendations and guidance for improving performance.
b. Recognizes the need to counsel subordinates and performs counseling in a timely fashion
c. Explains to the employee clearly what his/her responsibilities are and the standards of the performance to the employee
d. Disciplines subordinates when necessary and in accordance with collective bargaining and hospital policies and procedures.
e. Other duties as assigned


Minimum Qualifications

Two years of full-time, satisfactory experience performing storekeeping activities, at least one year of which must have been in a supervisory capacity.

How To Apply

If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

job_description:
Bachelor’s degree in Learning & Development, Organizational Development, HR, business or a related discipline.
10+ years’ experience in the areas of leadership development, organization development, learning and development, action learning, blended learning design, or equivalent business experience.
5+ years’ work experience of direct people management.

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on Earth and to be Earth’s best employer. Amazon is seeking a Leadership Development Sr Manager for our growing global Reliability and Maintenance Engineering (RME) organization to play a critical role in managing Amazon's fast growth and innovation.

The Amazon Reliability and Maintenance Engineering team maintains and optimizes technologies ranging from large, modern, purpose-built warehouses utilizing robotics and high-volume conveyance all the way through the value chain to small, high speed warehouses placed as close to our customers as possible. We maintain and optimize technologies in the Global Customer Fulfillment, Sort Center/Air, and Delivery Network. Come join us today on the Amazon Reliability and Maintenance Engineering team!

We are looking for a senior leader to implement our leadership development strategy and roadmap such that we can develop RME leaders across the global organization. This role entails providing strong consultation, and direction to senior leaders in RME such that we’re uncovering and addressing specific skill gaps in the leadership development space. The role will assess role-specific needs and challenges, architect blended learning journeys, and implement associated programs and performance support tools. This team will develop RME leaders through both virtual and hands-on design and facilitation of strategic learning initiatives and offerings. The role reports to the Senior Manager of Learning & Development for North America (NA) RME.

Key job responsibilities:

Serve as the single threaded leader for leadership development across RME.
Architect and implement a measurable L&D leadership development strategy and annual roadmap for RME.
Build high-trust partnerships with regional teams; influence leaders and stakeholders at the senior level; demonstrate effective consulting and coaching skills, with an ability to influence in all directions and at all levels.
Develop innovative solutions that both address top priority business needs and raise the bar on leadership behavior.
Work both independently and as part of a team to design and deliver targeted and engaging leadership solutions that are culturally aligned, best suit audience needs, and tangibly impact performance. Solutions may include in person leadership skill building workshops, team development events, virtual learning experiences, and on demand learning resources.
Design blended learning curriculums by application of adult learning theory to ensure learning outcomes are achieved. Draw upon a wide variety of techniques to ensure engagement, knowledge transfer, and skill development take place in a measurable way.
Adopt a global mind-set, exhibit cultural sensitivity, and relate to and work effectively across cultures
Design and implement leadership development programs; produce instructional materials and performance support materials; design evaluation methods to determine impact of program.
Maintain a pulse and insight into the everchanging leadership needs of RME
Collect, analyze, and communicate meaningful learning metrics through written and facilitated Business Reviews.
Deliver results with little supervision in a dynamic and often ambiguous environment.
Communicate clearly and concisely, including interpersonal and written communications.
In conjunction with our PXT Leadership Development team, coach senior RME leaders as required.
Lead a team of 3 direct reports.
Travel domestically up to 30%.
Master’s degree in Instructional Systems Design, Adult Learning/Education, Learning & Development, HR, Organizational Development or a related discipline.
Experience with Adult Learning, Adult Development, Human Performance Technology, Instructional Design, Training Delivery, and Training Evaluation is highly desirable.
Experience in implementing innovative learning and development solutions within a fast-paced global environment.
Executive coaching certification.
Experience working in an industrial maintenance and engineering environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

summary: As a supervisor you will develop and implement logistics plans, budgets, and procedures to improve compliance with customer needs within budget constraints.
job_description:
Summary
Posted: Oct 15, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200301114
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Do you wish to be challenged to think creatively? The people here at Apple don’t just craft products - they build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. The success we are striving will be the result of very skilled people working in an environment which cultivates creativity, partnership, and thinking of old problems in new ways. The Logistics Supervisor is responsible for oversight and management of designated Data Center logistics operations and related systems information. This position requires shipping, receiving, warehousing, and inventory control experience and necessitates a highly motivated individual with good communication and leadership skills. This person will ensure accountability and security of inventory through transaction documentation, process, procedure verification, and system review. The role will be responsible for providing daily guidance and leadership to a team of inventory control technicians, and forecasting data center consumable inventory needs in collaboration with the material planning team. As a supervisor you will develop and implement logistics plans, budgets, and procedures to improve compliance with customer needs within budget constraints. This position will be responsible for interaction with vendors and collaboration between peers in Deployments, Break Fix, Ops Planning, and other necessary functions to optimize systems and procedures.
Key Qualifications
Prior inventory management and or supply chain experience
Prior experience with Inventory and Warehouse Management systems
Proven leadership ability and understanding of team fundamentals to effectively lead and develop others
Highly motivated self-starter that is able to work independently, meet assigned deadlines and handle various tasks at one time
The candidate must demonstrate communication and coordination skills
Must be a solid teammate and have experience working extensively with cross functional teams
Candidate should be a strong visual storyteller and comfortable presenting to management
Extensive experience in warehousing, inventory control, shipping/receiving and general logistics operations
Ability to develop productive relationships and partner with Apple Business Groups & other Apple Data Center teams
Ability to pull together many sources of information to help prioritize and lead operations
Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision making skills
Exceptional ability to adapt guidance to meet Data Center objectives
Ability to react quickly to new information, opinion and direction
Minimum of 3-5+ years of operations experience in logistics, material management, or operations
Description
Apple's Data Center Operations Team is an exciting, fast paced, ever growing and changing environment supporting millions of customers. This team is responsible for deploying and maintaining equipment related to Apple's internet facing applications. As a Logistics Supervisor you'll be working in a fast-paced, and often ambiguous environment with multiple cross functional teams. Responsibilities Exercise judgement & provide direction to Data Center & Logistics technicians according to established company/data center policies & procedures Develop and mentor employees to continuously improve skills and team performance Management of contractor staffing, training, and oversight Plan resources to match highly variable workload Lead daily and weekly operations meetings with internal and external partners Proactively identify and mitigate risks to weekly production schedules Raise issues to appropriate channels for resolution; keep management advised of status, schedule, priorities and problems Identify issues and perform Root Cause Analysis to prevent future operational impact Work with peers to drive standard methodologies by recommending changes to enterprise/site policies & procedures Promote healthy and safe working environment through communication and monitoring of safety rules and regulations and handling ongoing safety training Daily inventory operations oversight using Lean and 5S principles Maintains inventory accuracy though cycle counts and physical inventory programs. Investigating inventory shortages and discrepancies and compliance with inventory policies & procedures Provide financial reporting and reconciliation of inventories as required
Education & Experience
Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience
Additional Requirements

job_description:
Clearly Rewarded.
Work for Our Water Resources.
Explore your potential and commit to a cause that matters for today and generations to come. Be part of a customer service focused team that is committed to preserve one of our most vital resources. Build a career that can become your life’s work with the Southwest Florida Water Management District (District).
Join our Procurement Services Office
Here is your opportunity to pursue a leadership position, supervising our procurement staff. You will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day tasks to include the purchasing cycle, coordination of all work assignments, contract negotiation, and award and review of all work products. As the Procurement Supervisor, you will also recommend and administer appropriate employment transactions, including but not limited to hiring, recognition, discipline, discharge, or other appropriate actions. You will be responsible for ensuring that policies and procedures are followed and work is equitably distributed while supporting and promoting management direction.
The District supports a flexible work environment and remote work schedules so that employees can enjoy their time outside of the District.
For helping to maintain our valuable water resources, we offer:
Florida retirement system/retirement benefits
Deferred compensation
Work-life balance
9 paid holidays
Generous vacation and sick leave
Medical, dental and vision insurance
Basic and voluntary life and AD&D insurance
Long-term disability
Supplemental insurance
Health savings & flexible spending accounts
Employee assistance program
Prescription drug coverage & mail order program
Legal and identity theft protection
Wellness program
Public service loan forgiveness qualified employer
Tuition reimbursement
State adoption benefit program qualified employer
Training and development resources
Innovative projects
Advanced technologies

Compensation: $60,000.00 - $75,000.00
The starting salary range is included for the Business Supervisor profile which reflects the minimum to approximately 59% of the respective pay grade. The starting salary will be based on the education and experience of the successful candidate. The District conducts annual performance evaluations that may award applicable pay increases based on positive employee performance.
Essential Functions
Coordinates the work and activity of assigned staff.
Develops specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish work. May perform project work for section as needs arise.
Assesses progress and performance of staff tasks and work assignments.
Identifies the developmental needs of others by coaching, mentoring, or otherwise helping others to improve their knowledge and skills.
Conducts performance discussions and provides access to appropriate training as necessary.
May assist Procurement Office Chief with developing processes and procedures for user end guidance on Procurement workflow along with providing metrics.
Responsible for development of customer focused procurement guidance documents and forms.
Working Conditions
Physical, Visual Acuity Requirements: Ability to see, sit, stand and lift up to 20 pounds on a regular basis.
Working Environmental Conditions: Works in a standard office environment; may occasionally drive to attend meetings and represent the District at conferences or other areas as needed.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Employee may be subject to call-in outside of regularly scheduled work hours, or required to be on call, including on nights, weekends or holidays, to respond to emergency management activities or other incidents requiring rapid response in support of District operations.
Required Credentials for Procurement Supervisor Opportunity
High School Diploma or equivalent and eight (8) years' procurement or purchasing related work experience OR Associate's degree and six (6) years' procurement or purchasing related work experience OR Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Business Administration or related field and four (4) years' procurement or purchasing related work experience
Valid Driver's License
Preferred Credentials for Procurement Supervisor Opportunity
Supervisory experience
Experience in a public-sector environment, including work with state or local government
Application Process
The District will determine eligibility for employment solely from the information provided on a District employment application. All applicants are required to complete, in full, a District employment application. Any application that is not complete will not receive consideration for the position. A resume will not be considered as a substitute for the information requested on the application for purposes of qualification.
Additional Details
This position is typically scheduled to work 40 hours per week, Monday to Friday, out of the Brooksville, FL office. This position is eligible for compensatory time for hours worked over 40 hours, in a week.
Travel Required
Yes. Some travel, using District vehicle, within the District's coverage area.
Accepting applications until February 15, 2021 at 4:00 PM
About Us
Managing the water resources for west-central Florida, our district includes approximately 10,000 square miles of territory spanning 16 counties and serving more than 5 million residents. Established in 1961 as a flood-protection agency, our objective is to meet the needs of current and future water users, protect and preserve our water resources, manage the water supply, protect water quality, and preserve water-related functions.
Apply Now
The District prides itself on providing a positive work flexible environment that engages and supports our employees. This could be the opportunity of a lifetime. Click on the link to apply and put yourself to work for our water resources.
#WorkForOurWater
Equal Employment Opportunity/Veterans Preference/Drug-Free Workplace/Tobacco Free Campuses.
All applicants shall receive equal consideration and treatment in employment without regard to race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, sex, marital status, familial status, or medical condition. All recruitment, hiring, placements, transfers and promotions will be on the basis of individual skills, knowledge and abilities, and the feasibility of any necessary job accommodation(s).
The Southwest Florida Water Management District (District) does not discriminate on the basis of disability in regard to job application procedures, hiring, and other terms and conditions of employment. It is further the policy of the District to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in all aspects of the employment process. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing an application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to (352) 796-7211 or 1-800-423-1476 (FL only), ext. 4747; or email ADACoordinator@WaterMatters.org. If you are hearing or speech impaired, please contact the agency using the Florida Relay Service, 1-800-955-8771 (TDD) or 1-800-955-8770 (Voice). In the event of a complaint, please follow the grievance procedure located at WaterMatters.org/ADA.
The District participates in E-Verify employment eligibility verification. We will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization.
