summary:
As a Production Supervisor, you will coordinate duties of approximately 15 production operators.
These duties include improving safety, reducing costs,…
job_description:
At allnex, you can go to work knowing you make a lasting impact on the world around you. Our work helps to protect and improve more than 1,000 products; from interior coatings for airplanes and scratch-resistant coatings for smartphones, to corrosion protection for cars, and even printing inks for glossy magazines. We are present in 4 regions, with more than 4,000 employees globally, and serve customers in over 100 countries, which makes allnex the world's leading industrial coatings resins company.

Please, come and see allnex insights – Let’s make an impact together!

And here is a sneak peek, how life at allnex sites looks like - allnex Operator Movie
Position overview
As a Production Supervisor, you will coordinate duties of approximately 15 production operators. These duties include improving safety, reducing costs, improving quality, maximizing the department's effectiveness through long term planning and project implementation, providing appropriate training and development, ensuring consistent roll out of plant policies & procedures, and maintaining open communications and positive employee relations. In this role, you will also drive continuous improvement within your team.
Responsibilities
Organize and monitor all production activities within your area of focus
Implement manufacturing schedules and procedures, work with your team to maximize productivity
Analyze production records to identify problems and recommend solutions
Optimize production workflows, minimize disruption to manufacturing schedules
Minimize manufacturing cost, decrease waste output, keep high quality standards
Ensure a safe way of running the production lines and organize regular safety inspections
Routine cleaning and regular maintenance in production lines, ensure good visual appearance
Collect data for production statistics and cost reduction
Actively support engineering activities to improve the efficiency, equipment and process
Keep confidentiality of the production arts and product formula
Cooperate closely with our maintenance team to maximize plant equipment availability
Required skills and experience
Familiar with key unit operations of fine chemical manufacturing, ideally in a leadership position
Production experience of coating resins is preferred
Strong safety awareness
Troubleshooting and root cause analysis skills
Good Microsoft Office Knowledge
Good leadership
Eager to learn
Able to work under high pressure
Qualifications
College or above
Major chemical engineering is preferred
We offer
We are proud to offer an international working experience with a tight-knit network of employees, making it easy to connect and learn from people all across our different functions. On top of that we are a truly innovative company with a strong team spirit, openness to new ideas, and great opportunities to grow and develop your career.
Equal Employment Opportunity
allnex is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to an environment where all colleagues contribute for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our communities.

Find out how you can make an impact!
Check out our career page for available opportunities. We look forward to hearing from you.
www.allnex.com

summary: Equivalent to graduation from high school and 6 years of criminal justice experience; lead or supervisor experience is desirable.
job_description:
About the Position

Career Opportunity
The city of Las Vegas is accepting applications for Court Services Supervisor. This position plans, prioritizes, assigns, supervises, and reviews the work of staff responsible for the various functions of the Municipal Court; oversees and participates in all work activities; revises, drafts, and implements work procedures; and performs a variety of technical tasks relative to assigned area of responsibility.

Application Details
Applicants should fully describe, for each applicable employer, their qualifications and experience, with specific reference to each of the minimum qualifications and essential functions found in the job posting.

Examination Process (Supplemental Questionaire)
A civil service examination will be conducted in accordance with the Civil Service Rules of the city of Las Vegas. The supplemental questions are the examination. Falsification of information may result in disqualification from a recruitment or removal from a City position. Additional information will not be accepted after the closing date.

The supplemental questions are weighted 100% for placement on an eligible list, and must be worked on individually by the applicant only. The supplemental questions of the most qualified applicants will be reviewed for placement on an eligible list.

Eligible List
You must score 70% or higher on the examination to be placed on the eligible list.

Selection Process
Final candidate selection will include list placement and may include hiring interview (if applicable). Any individual offered employment will be required to pass a pre-employment drug test, complete background check, education and experience verification, and may be required to demonstrate the ability to perform the physical requirements of the job. Some positions may require preliminary background checks.

Supervision Received and Exercised
Receives direction from the assigned division manager and higher level management.
Acts as a formal supervisor, exercising direct supervision, including selecting new employees, monitoring and formally evaluating employee performance, and participating in the discipline and termination of employees.
Essential Functions:
Acts as first line supervisor for designated staff within a work unit, including interviewing and selecting of job applicants, training, overseeing work, and establishing and evaluating appropriate performance standards in accordance with Court objectives.
Ensures employees adhere to established work methods, techniques and schedules, and comply with applicable city and Court policies and procedures.
Directs the workflow of the unit to ensure the work is fairly distributed, priority work is handled promptly, and deadlines are met.
Oversees automated systems and workflows. Creates activity reports. Assists with system upgrades or process improvements. Audits various workflow processes. Researches problems and provides recommendations to improve productivity and efficiency. Implements new and updated policies and procedures. Develops productivity and accuracy standards for assigned shift or work unit.
Supervises the collection of fines, bail, bonds and program fees. Arranges and schedules court ordered installment agreements. Monitors financial transactions, including cash counts, cash reports, forfeiture reports, bail trust accounts, and audits.
Maintains control over cash drawers. Verifies payments, reconciles deposits, and performs audits of banks. Monitors the automatic call distribution system and/or queuing system to ensure prompt response to customers; evaluates staff activity in clearing system queues; monitors accuracy and quality of information given to customers.
Processes and directly supervises the processing of all cases filed in the court. Oversees and participates in the timely and accurate preparation and processing of cases, records coordination, court summaries, appeals and data entry of new criminal citations.
Oversees and reviews the entry of various legal documents, such as warrants, citations, arrest or incident records, and other court related documents into the Municipal Court database. Enters data from various sources. Inputs corrections and updates. Verifies data for accuracy and completeness. Compiles data from a variety of sources, and produces legal forms, documents, and reports in accordance with established procedures.
Participates in the administration of the division budget. Submits budget recommendations. Monitors all financial transactions, expenditures, and identifies and reports potential financial overruns and variances at an early stage. Prepares reports on actual and estimated revenues and expenditures.
Oversees ongoing programs and special projects assigned by division manager. Monitors program or project performance and ensures adequate resource allocation and usage. Maintains accurate participant records. Ensures program compliance with various local, state, and federal regulations through audits site and/or defendant home visits. Prepares various reports, including defendant reports to be used in court cases or parole hearings.
Recommends and assists in the implementation of division goals and objectives. Assists with the annual development and submission of business plan measures. Prepares and presents monthly performance statistics and reports. Recommends, creates and implements approved policies and procedures. Analyze data and statistical reports at varying levels of complexity and frequency. Develops and maintains training procedures and manual for department operation. Recommends and initiates approved procedural changes.
Serves as liaison for the division with other city departments, divisions, public and outside agencies. Receives and responds to complex and sensitive issues. Handles inquiries and complaints from start through resolution in an efficient and timely manner.
Coordinates and oversees records management process including seal order requests, and traffic and criminal document retention and destruction cycles. Provides court documentation, records, and information services to internal and external agencies, and the general public.
Ensures all judicial orders, policy and procedures and court programs/ guidelines are followed and appropriately handled throughout the court.

Marginal Functions:
Attends and participates in professional group meetings. Stays abreast of new trends, programs and innovations.
Performs a variety of clerical duties.
Performs related duties and responsibilities as required.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Experience and Education Requirements

Must fully meet one of the following by date of application with no substitutions:
Bachelors Degree with increasing responsibility in a work environment; lead or supervior experience is desirable, OR
Associates Degree with a minimum of 3 years direct court experience; lead or supervisor experience is desirable, OR
Equivalent to graduation from high school and 6 years of criminal justice experience; lead or supervisor experience is desirable.

License or Certificate

Must obtain applicable level of NCIC/NCJIS certification and/or training within 6 months of the date of appointment and maintain proficiency as needed.

Depending on assignment, possession of an appropriate, valid driver's license on the date of application, and maintenance thereafter.

Knowledge of:

Operations, services and activities of a Municipal Court program.
Principles and techniques of program planning, development and evaluation.
Basic principles and practices of budget preparation and administration.
English usage, spelling, grammar, punctuation and composition.
Principles and techniques of supervision, training and performance evaluation.
Principles and practices of motivating employees
Modern and complex principles and practices of record keeping and records management.
Modern office procedures, practices and equipment, including common office software.
Pertinent federal, state and local laws, codes and regulations.
Applicable computerized law enforcement information systems
Operations, services and activities of the criminal justice system

Skills in:

Reading, interpreting, applying, explaining, and enforcing applicable city and court policies and procedures, and applicable laws and regulations.
Using initiative and independent judgment within established guidelines.
Defining issues, collecting and analyzing pertinent data, identifying alternative solutions, projecting consequences of proposed actions, drawing valid conclusions, proposing sound recommendations, and implementing approved solution in support of goals.
Managing multiple assignments.
Planning, organizing and prioritizing assignments.
Working independently without direct supervision.
Preparing clear and concise reports.
Communicating clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.
Establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with those contacted in the course of work including city officials and the general public.
Communicating with individuals from a variety of social, cultural, economic and educational backgrounds while demonstrating respect and sensitivity for perceived differences.

Supervisor Competencies

Professionalism – Models core values by being honest, respectful and positive; continuously demonstrates the core values of the city; supervisory actions are collaborative whenever possible and intended to grow the city's capacity at an individual, unit, division and/or department level.

Managing Performance – Takes responsibility for own and assigned employees' performance, by setting clear goals and expectations, tracking progress against the goals, ensuring regular feedback, and addressing performance problems and issues promptly.

Decisiveness – Willingness to make difficult decisions in a timely manner.

Developing and Empowering Others – Willingness to delegate responsibility; coaching assigned employee to develop their capabilities.

Facilitating Partnerships – Builds community and partnerships both inside and outside the organization.

Forward Thinking – Anticipating the consequences of situations and decisions; taking appropriate action to be prepared for possible changes.

Providing Support – Provides the tools and creates a supportive environment that allows others to successfully complete their work.
CITY OF LAS VEGAS, NEVADA LVCEA Compensation and Benefits - 2021COMPENSATIONAnnual Base Pay Increases Negotiated as part of the collective bargaining process. Step (Merit) Increase – typically awarded on the anniversary date of hire, up to range maximum.
BENEFITSUniform Allowance Available for some classifications.
Tool/Equipment Allowance Available for some classifications.
Retirement Benefit eligible employees participate in the Public Employees' Retirement System of Nevada (PERS). PERS, a statewide defined benefit plan, calculates retirement benefits based on 2.25 percent (current percentage for employees hired 7/1/15 and after) for each year of service, applied to the employee's highest consecutive 36-month average salary. PERS also requires that employees share 50 percent of the PERS contribution, which is implemented by reducing the City's salary ranges. The highest consecutive 36-month average salary is increased commensurate with the salary range reductions required by PERS.Deferred Compensation The city offers a 457(b) Plan which is a government deferred compensation plan similar to a 401(k) plan. It offers both pre-tax and after-tax savings and investment options.
Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Employees are covered the first of the month following date of employment. Five medical plans, two dental and two vision plans are available. City pays 100% of employee premium + 50% of dependent premium.
Life and AD&D Insurance City provides $20,000 policies at no cost. Additional voluntary life insurance and AD&D insurance available for purchase.
Disability Insurance City provides a long term disability policy: LTD: Employees who normally work at least 30 hours/week are eligible. Benefits begin after 90 days of disability. Payment is up to 60% of earnings, up to $11,000/month, and may not be supplemented with sick or vacation. Tuition Reimbursement

Employee Assistance Program
ANNUAL PHYSICAL EXAMS Employees covered by a City health plan and their covered spouse and dependents over age 18 are eligible for a comprehensive wellness physical exam annually at no cost to them at WellTrac.
VACATION (Hours/Year) Year 1-2: 80 hours Years 3-7: 120 hours Years 8-10: 128 hours Years 11-15: 180 hours Year 16 and over: 200 hours Maximum accrual: 250 hours, if hired after 12/3/2014 Sell-back: Up to 60 hours each year; must leave a balance of 40 hours in leave bank.
HOLIDAYS City provides 11 paid holidays plus a birthday holiday.
SICK LEAVE Sick Leave: 104 hours per year Maximum Accrual: 420 hours, if hired after 12/03/2014 Sick Leave Bonus: Negotiated sick leave bonus Payout at Separation: After 5 years of service, 50% of vested hours up to cap; after 20 years of service or more, 100% of vested hours up to cap.
RETIREE HEALTH AND LIFE INSURANCE Available for purchase - retiree pays full cost of premiums.


NOTE: Benefits subject to change
Revised 01/2021

summary: The Industrial Engineer position supports the logistics organization through a variety of projects focused on enhancing productivity, maximizing throughput and…
job_description:
Overview
The Industrial Engineer position supports the logistics organization through a variety of projects focused on enhancing productivity, maximizing throughput and ensuring workplace safety. Position will work closely with the Operations and Engineering team on developing standards, creating productivity measurements, leading process improvement initiatives and driving packaging efficiencies.
Responsibilities
Development and maintenance of an accurate and effective Work Measurement System. Ensure effective productivity measurements are established for identified functions in the distribution center through time and frequency studies.
Evaluate and revise work methods and workflow for all functions to ensure best method practices
Lead the training of management and hourly workforce on productivity and work methods
Manage the execution of the Productivity Reporting system and provide support to the Productivity Accountability Program using a Labor Management System
Assist in the analysis and cost justification on all capital project requests
Lead the collection of data to assist in the development of distribution center and capital budgets
Analyze and evaluate existing systems and processes, identifying value-added and non-value-added activities to solve design challenges
Assist in the design, selection and installation of material handling equipment incorporated into existing, new and expanded distribution centers
Serve as in-house expert on packaging initiatives including materials, quality, automation and vendor compliance.
Work effectively with external resources (consultants and contractors) to ensure collaborative partnerships to meet business requirements.
Qualifications
1-3 years experience in a Direct to Consumer or similar distribution environment
Warehouse Management and Labor Management Systems
Time Keeping systems
Statistical Analysis, Operations Research and Line Balancing
Individual Incentive System Programs
Excellent PC skills – MS Suite
AutoCAD
Database Management
Job Skills
Experience in a highly automated distribution environment
Experience with projects involving installation and implementation of MHE equipment
Experience in a goods to person (GTP) environment
Demonstrated experience with work measurement methodologies and tools with an emphasis on time studies and standards creation
Expertise in projects related to process design, work measurement, productivity improvement, cost reduction and project implementation
Experience with Manhattan WM, LM, and SCI reporting modules
Experience in best methods development
Experience with productivity tracking, data collection systems, and analytical software tools
Experience performing cost analysis for project justification
Experience in Lean/Six Sigma or similar continuous improvement programs
Solid technical understanding of packaging materials and processes.
Strong ability to gather, analyze and interpret information and develop, recommend and implement solutions while maintaining budget
Excellent planning, organization, and problem solving skills
Effective communication skills; demonstrated ability to interact across a broad range of organizational levels and functions
Excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to work independently with little or no direct supervision
25% Travel on an Annual Basis
Must be flexible with schedule and able to work overtime in a fast-paced environment

Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering
Location
Kansas City, MO (Kansas City, KS by late 2022/early 2023)
Travel

job_title: Supervisor, Reporting & Data Analysis - Remote Available
summary: The Supervisor, Reporting and Data Analysis is responsible for reviewing all work prepared by unit associates and for associate training and development.
location: Remote in Rancho Cordova, CA+1 location
job_description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 25 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, multi-national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.
Position Purpose:
The Supervisor, Reporting and Data Analysis is responsible for reviewing all work prepared by unit associates and for associate training and development. The Unit is made up of professional level data analysts who extract, analyze, and interpret data from across claims, patient and provider information systems to address issues such as medical utilization, opportunities for operational efficiencies, and organizational performance against service standards. The Supervisor also prepares complex data analyses for internal and external customers. The Supervisor provides ongoing support and training for internal and external users of the Information Warehouse including the Data Warehouse, Data Summaries/Reports and Performance Management Dashboard.
Manages staff workload and deadline requirements; prioritizes and allocates resources; hires, trains, evaluates, disciplines and motivates assigned staff.
Extract’s data and generates reports using Business Objects.
Creates spreadsheets using Access and Excel.
Communicates findings, trend analyses and recommendations verbally and in writing to committees, clinical staff, management, and external clients.
Develops and manages reporting templates used to analyze and interpret data.
Designs complex ad hoc reports to support a variety of functional areas.
Works with internal and external customers to develop financial, clinical and operational reports.
Continuously supports and trains internal and external users of the Information Warehouse.
Ensure data quality as well as quality of all outgoing reports and analyses.
Coordinates all Information Warehouse User Acceptance Testing.
Works directly with technology partner in the development and future modification of the Information Warehouse.
Partnering with the DHA, Tricare east contractor and military treatment facility leadership to develop a collaborative relationship.
Other duties as assigned.
Our Comprehensive Benefits Package:
Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility
Competitive pay
Paid Time Off including paid holidays
Health insurance coverage for you and dependents
401(k) and stock purchase plans
Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development
Education/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in healthcare, economics, business (with an economics or statistics emphasis), mathematics or statistics. Four years related experience including experience with Business Objects, Excel and Access. Previous lead or supervisory experience desired

This position will be supporting a Federal government contract, therefore it requires U. S. citizenship and proof of favorable adjudication following submission of Department of Defense form SF86 or higher security.
Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.
Centene is proud to offer competitive benefits for this position. They are available for review at: https://jobs.centene.com/us/en/benefits.
The salary range is $90,000 - $130,000.

summary: Work closely with our animation producers, directors, and supervisors with a focus on creating the highest quality imagery while also maximizing efficiencies.
job_description:
It’s the magic of immersing yourself in a motion picture masterpiece, or a new track from your favorite band, or the spectacle of a live Broadway show. It’s hard to define and even harder to create, but that’s what we do at The Walt Disney Studios. Ours is a culture of innovation, collaboration and creativity. We raise the bar, then step over it, blazing trails through the production and distribution of world-class entertainment around the globe. If you want to help tell compelling, enduring stories through movies, music or stage plays, then we want to hear from you.
The Walt Disney Company
Imagine a career with an organization that brings smiles to millions every day. Imagine working with people whose passion for what they do is simply indescribable. We are The Walt Disney Company, live with a rich legacy of innovation, entertainment, and lifelong memories. With our vast array of both businesses and professionals, you’ll have the opportunity to join a team that’s beloved around the world, and to find out how it feels to love what you do. We invite you to discover for yourself why a career with Disney is the opportunity you‘ve been looking for.


The Walt Disney Studios encompasses the creation, production, promotion, sales, acquisition and domestic and international distribution of live-action and animated motion pictures, home entertainment releases, live stage plays, and music and soundtrack recordings. From movie concept to film production, and global premieres to direct to consumer mobile applications, Studio Technology innovates and delivers solutions that support a studio whose content is legendary and transcends generations. As part of the Studio’s Technology team you’ll be joining a group of passionate, dedicated technologists solving a range of interesting problems in innovative ways in an exciting and dynamic industry. We are looking for high-performing, motivated individuals who are generalists and proficient in many technologies and languages. Our team embraces disruptive thinkers who can drive innovation.


The Walt Disney Studios has created one of the most powerful brands by bringing memorable, life-changing storytelling to the world. Our studio film franchises have redefined the genre in building a universe filled with creativity, innovation, and collaboration.

As part of the Motion Picture Labs at Walt Disney Studios; you will be joining a group of seasoned, dedicated technologists solving a range of interesting problems in innovative ways in an exciting and dynamic environment.

The Motion Picture Labs is looking for an Animation Image & Color Pipeline Supervisor to provide imaging science support for various projects within Marvel and across the broader Disney Studio Technology organization. You will provide end to end expertise for animation projects from storyboards to finishing; investigate emerging image processing technologies; design and develop imaging pipeline solutions; and contribute to the development of standards for our studio and the broader industry. You will report to the Senior Manager of Image & Color at Walt Disney Studios in Burbank, CA.


Responsibilities :

Work closely with our animation producers, directors, and supervisors with a focus on creating the highest quality imagery while also maximizing efficiencies.
Design end to end color management workflows for animated productions.
Troubleshoot with vendors and internal teams when workflows are challenged.
Author technical delivery specifications.
Collaborate with Live-Action Image & Color Team to establish studio wide standardization.
Serve as a stakeholder for studio tools and applications, working closely with developers and technical directors.
Oversee and partner with The Walt Disney Studios StudioLAB and Disney Research as it pertains to animation and Computer Graphics.

Basic Qualifications :

Minimum 10 years' experience in VFX Computer Graphics or Feature Animation industry; working within the context of a large studio / vendor capacity.
Significant supervision and/or management experience.
Proven knowledge of pipeline production workflows.
Ability to understand the demands of a production driven environment.
Experience working alongside senior management.
Talent to influence and build strong working relationships across multiple vendors and departments.

Preferred Qualifications:

Cross experience with Feature Animation, VFX Theatrical and Streaming Live-Action, and VR special projects.
Experience working within standards organizations and proven experience contributing to the industry at large.

job_description:

job_description:
Title: Park Supervisor – Natural Resource Supervisor 2, Parks and Trails, Lake Maria State Park
Why work for Minnesota State Parks and Trails?


Are you looking for a career that lets you live out your passion? The MN DNR is committed to creating a

healthy, sustainable, livable Minnesota for everyone. We are dedicated to protecting and managing

Minnesota’s cultural resources and natural resources while providing access to outdoor recreation

opportunities. Your work will have an impact and help us with our vision to create unforgettable park,

trail and water recreation experiences that inspire people to pass along the love for the outdoors to

current and future generations.


This is a (Year-round) full-time position at Lake Maria State Park, near Monticello, Minnesota which also

manages the nearby Ann Lake campground and day-use area in the Sand Dunes State Forest. Hours of

work and days off will vary and include regular weekends, some evening shifts, and holidays.


This position exists to direct and implement Department of Natural Resources and Division of Parks and

Trails programs, activities, policies and rules as the manager at Lake Maria State Park and the Ann Lake

campgrounds and day use areas.
Responsibilities include:

Personnel management: Recruit, interview, hire, direct, schedule and train employees.
Physical plant management: Repair, maintenance and custodial services for buildings, grounds,
utilities and all other facilities.

Fiscal management: Management of revenue operations, budgets and purchasing of goods and
services.

Resource management: Management of natural and cultural resources of the park.
Visitor services and interpretive program management: Administration of vehicle permit sales,
campground operation and operation of all public facilities. Also includes administration of the

park's personal and non-personal interpretive programs.
Enforcement and emergency services: Enforcement of all relevant rules and statutes as well as
provide for emergency response to ensure visitor safety.
Public relations: Provide customer service/information both to park visitors and to the local
community via media outlets. Implement visitor services activities and programming to increase

outreach/involvement with local community interest groups.
Policy and planning: Setting up a unit management plan for the park and participating in Division
and Department planning groups.
Safety.
Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications
Current (ONE YEAR) experience as a Natural Resources Supervisor 2 – Parks.
OR
Bachelor’s or advanced degree in Natural Resources Management, Parks and Recreation,
Natural Science, Communications, public relations, business management, political science,

public administration, social science, education, interpretation, or closely related field and ONE

YEAR professional or para-professional level experience in a natural resources setting, agency or

organization including supervisory or lead work responsibilities.
AND
Conflict resolution skills/experience
Writing skills sufficient to communicate work plans, proposals, and reports.
Oral communication skills sufficient to communicate work requirements to individuals and
groups.

Organizational and administrative skills sufficient to organize diverse elements or work and
perform tasks within administrative requirements.

Project management skills sufficient to ensure projects are organized, tracked and completed on
a timely basis.

Ability to work collaboratively and uphold the culture of respect.
Fiscal skills sufficient to administer budgets and track expenditures and/or income.
Ability to comprehend laws, rules, policies and procedures.
Knowledge of natural and cultural resource requirements, including interpretive programs.
Understanding of safety requirements as they relate to working with a variety of equipment and
machinery.

Word processing skills sufficient to draft memos, letters, etc.
Spreadsheet skills sufficient to create, modify and manipulate spreadsheet data.
Ability to perform physically demanding tasks and operate in adverse and extreme
environments.

Ability to operate and maintain a variety of vehicles, shop and office equipment

Our Procurement Travel Services team is dedicated to enhance the business travel experience for employees and ensure their safety and well-being. job_description:
GREAT PEOPLE | GREAT BENEFITS | JOIN OUR ALL-STAR TEAM!
Cashier

Guest Services, Inc. offers amazing benefits such as medical, dental, vision, a 401K savings program, paid time off, employee discounts at recreational and lodging facilities nationwide, and more! Benefits may vary based on employment type.
This position pays $11.00/hour.
Apply today to join our All Star Team!
In accordance with Guest Services, Inc.’s (Guest Services) duty to provide and maintain a workplace that is free of known hazards, we maintain a vaccination policy to safeguard the health of our employees and their families; our customers and visitors; and the community at large from infectious diseases, such as COVID-19. All team members are required to comply with the vaccination policy which requires vaccinations subject to approved medical exemptions. All incoming team members must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 within 6 weeks of their hire date. Until such time as the employee is fully vaccinated, weekly testing and daily masking are required. Any team member not in compliance with this policy will be subject to disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment.
JOB SUMMARY
The Cashier is responsible for receiving money from and disbursing money to customers, while maintaining a high level of customer service at all times.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Identify items and corresponding cost of items and tabulate bills quickly and accurately using cash register, calculator, or other price equipment.
Issue receipts, refunds, credit, or change due to customers accurately.
Maintain cash register and contents within.
Turn in cash drawer and sales reconciliation at shifts’ end.
Smile and greet customers entering unit; answer customers’ questions, and provide information on company products, promotions, and policies. Thank each customer.
Maintain clean and orderly cash station area; stock and maintain sales area with various supplies and products.
Maintain neatness and cleanliness of the retail operation.
Maintain awareness of safety issues, and report them immediately to your manager.
SKILL AND KNOWLEDGE REQUIREMENTS INCLUDE
Partial High School education; High School Diploma/G.E.D. preferred.
Mathematic Skills.
Excellent sanitation habits.
Professional appearance.
Ability to communicate and attend to guests with the highest standard of service.
Ability to pass cash handling training.
Problem sensitivity and the ability to recognize when a problem has occurred and communicate it to management.
PHYSICAL AND MENTAL REQUIREMENTS
Moving about on foot to accomplish tasks, particularly frequent movements from place to place within the unit. Bend, lift, carry, reach/extend arms and hands above shoulder height frequently, or otherwise move in a constantly changing environment.
Lifting, carrying, and pushing up to 10 lbs. regularly, 10-15 lbs. frequently, and up to 25 lbs. occasionally.
Withstanding temperature extremes in indoor/outdoor environments.
Reading and writing work-related documents in English.
Speech recognition and clarity, including the ability to understand the speech of customers and co-workers and the ability to speak clearly so that you can be understood by customers and co-workers in English.
Constantly communicates and receives verbal communication with other employees in a sometimes fast paced environment.
Physical attendance in unit to perform duties.
Ability to stand for the entire work day.
EQUIPMENT USED
Knowledge of cash register/computer used in unit.
Guest Services, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

job_description:
Job Summary:
The Payroll Supervisor will perform all activities necessary to process domestic and international payrolls, including maintaining related records, filing tax reports and voluntary deduction reports, processing involuntary deductions such as levies and garnishments, preparing accounting transactions and documents, documenting and updating procedures, and preparing special reports for management.
Responsibilities:
Oversees daily activities of employees to ensure daily work volume and service level meets standards.
Assist Payroll Manager in monitoring workload and evaluate direct reports.
Assist in Training team members on new or enhanced operation procedures and Payroll policies
Performs all necessary activities to complete semi-monthly and monthly payroll, including payroll data processing and maintenance, payroll calculation, payment disbursement, administration of tax forms, deposits and fillings, international allowances, quick pays, etc.
Performs all necessary activities related to time reporting, including time collection system administration, labor processing and distribution, etc.
Adheres to and analyzes payroll processes and procedures and makes recommendations for process improvements.
Resolves and responds to payroll processing and employee inquiries following SLA requirements.
Responds to outside requests for payroll information such as employment and wage verifications, garnishment inquiries, tax notices, third party vendors, etc.
Ensures confidentiality and security of payroll files, systems and reports in compliance with various governmental regulations.
Assists with system administration, testing and upgrades.
Assists with responses to audit, regulatory and general ledger inquiries. Prepares and reconciles journal entries.
Assists with quarter and year end processing.
Assists with preparing of relevant and requested management reports and audits.
Assists and/or leads additional projects as assigned

Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree and 8 years of experience, Master's degree and 6 years of experience, PhD and 1 years of experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Skill & Abilities:
Proficient knowledge of payroll tax and labor laws, garnishment requirements, payroll recordkeeping and reporting regulations
Understanding of HIPAA and FLSA regulations.
Highly preferred experience and knowledge of Deltek and Oracle systems.
Excellent knowledge of MS Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel.
Ability to prioritize multiple tasks.
Ability to meet deadlines.
Ability to work well with others.
Ability to listen and communicate well both verbally and in writing.
Ability to work independently and within teams.
Attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to obtain proper security clearances as noted by contracts.

job_description:
Position Summary/Position

Under the direction of the Health Education Manager, this position supervises health education operations including Team Member engagement, the daily maintenance of work schedules, calendar of events, procedural compliance, and quality assurance. Supervision of the Team is evaluated using a variety of performance standards including metrics, productivity measures, and quality control monitoring. Major Functions (Duties and Responsibilities)

1. Monitors Health Education activities to ensure compliance with all IEHP, state and federal regulatory requirements.
2. Works closely with Health Education Leadership to ensure adherence to Health Education principles, processes, and workflows across all programs and/or populations.
3. Provides leadership, support and administrative supervision of the Health Education Specialists and Health Educators to ensure delivery of high quality, cost effective services to members.
4. Trains and onboards new Team Members by setting goals and measures for successful program implementation.
5. Leads to ensure team members are given every opportunity to succeed in their positions by developing Performance Goals and evaluating performance over time.
6. Keeps the Team informed of any programmatic and/or organizational changes across IEHP departments to ensure accurate information is being provided to all Members and Partners
7. Coordinates the monthly calendar of events to ensure equitable Member access to Health Education programs and/or activities.
8. Conducts weekly quality assurance activities including but not limited to Verint Monitoring, POWER BI data reporting, and Workforce Management reporting.
9. Communicates regular feedback to Team Member(s) based on quality assurance audits.
10. Models the importance of member experience and engages Health Education leadership in developing and implementing process improvement activities.
11. Collaborates with Health Education vendors, IEHP members and other departments to promote Health Education’s menu of services.
12. Partners with key stakeholders to establish and maintain workflow processes ensuring the delivery of high-quality services at specific project sites.
13. Demonstrates proficiency in all electronic medical management systems (e.g., MedHok, MediTrac, Super Search and Web Portal) to effectively manage quality assurance needs.
14. Represents the Health Education at selected IEHP meetings including external events as necessary.
15. Participates in the evaluation meetings which measures efficiency and program outcomes that identify problems, analyze specific data, and communicate results-based solutions.
16. Support operations of Heath Education that meets the needs and challenges of IEHP’s priority populations. Supervisory Responsibilities Leader: Administers Hires, Terminations, and Performance Reviews Experience Qualifications

Requires a total of five (5) years of experience as health educator or health education required. Total of five (5) years of experience of supervision/management experience with demonstrated Team leadership ability over the past 3 years. Preferred Experience Education Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Public Health, Health Science, Health Promotion, or Healthcare from an accredited institution required Preferred Education Professional Certification

(M)CHES preferred Professional Licenses Drivers License Required Yes, must have a valid California Driver's license and valid automobile insurance. Must qualify and maintain driving record to drive company vehicles based on IEHP insurance standards of no more than three (3) points. Knowledge Requirement

Knowledge of key leadership principles and team engagement values. Understanding of behavioral medicine and evidence-based health programs that aim to positively impact quality of life indicators and related performance measures. Ability to comprehend community level engagement to ensure program participation. Familiarity of delivering health promotion programs in the community. Skills Requirement

Communication. Leadership/ Personnel Management. Engagement. Time and Attendance Tracking. Customer Management Software. Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Strong organization skills and must be computer literate. Proficient in the use of Microcomputer applications (e.g. Microsoft Word and Excel, Power Point) for use in all aspects of an office environment and ability to learn new computer systems. Abilities Requirement

Analytical, time management, and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication, interpersonal and organization. Commitment to Team Culture

The IEHP Team environment requires a Team Member to participate in the IEHP Team Culture. A Team Member demonstrates support of the Culture by developing professional and effective working relationships that include elements of respect and cooperation with Team Members, Members and associates outside of our organization. Working Conditions

Regional Travel required for on-site meetings and performance audits. Physical Requirements Keyboarding: Traditional - FREQUENTLY Keyboarding: Touch-Screen - FREQUENTLY Keyboarding: 10-Key - FREQUENTLY Hearing: One-on-One - FREQUENTLY Communicate: Information/ideas verbally - FREQUENTLY Near Visual Acuity - FREQUENTLY Sitting - CONSTANTLY Lighting - CONSTANTLY Indoors - FREQUENTLY Regular contacts: co-workers, supervisor - FREQUENTLY Memory - FREQUENTLY Understand and follow direction - FREQUENTLY Regular and reliable attendance - CONSTANTLY

Starting Salary: $90,992.10 - $116,016.58
Pay rate will commensurate with experience

Inland Empire Health Plan (IEHP) is the largest not-for-profit Medi-Cal and Medicare health plan in the Inland Empire. We are also one of the largest employers in the region. With a provider network of more than 6,000 and a team of more than 2,000 employees, IEHP provides quality, accessible healthcare services to more than 1.2 million members. And our mission and core values help guide us in the development of innovative programs and the creation of an award winning workplace. As the healthcare landscape is transformed, we’re ready to make a difference today and in the years to come. Join our Team and Make a Difference with us! CFD Engineer / Senior CFD Engineer (DOE)

We sponsor H1B visas. We are open to employees working remotely.

Come work in one of the best small cities in the US1 for one of the best companies in New Mexico2! Flow Science is growing tech company with deep roots looking for outstanding engineers with an interest or expertise in the aerospace, automotive, additive manufacturing, and consumer products industries.

Principal Responsibilities and Key Requirements

CFD engineers work at the intersection of classical physics, numerical methods, and computer science. We apply our expertise in these fields to help clients solve complex real-world engineering problems, teach applied CFD, and guide our development teams to create new models that grow our capabilities and application areas. This challenging and dynamic role requires the following skills to be successful:

An engineering degree from an ABET or equivalently accredited university and some work experience
MS degree (mechanical, aerospace, or chemical engineering preferred) and engineering internship experience OR
BS degree (mechanical, aerospace, or chemical engineering preferred) and 2+ years of engineering work experience
Candidates with 5+ years of experience using commercial CFD code in industry can be considered for the Senior CFD Engineer position.
Strong understanding of engineering fundamentals, particularly fluid mechanics, heat transfer, and solid mechanics
Excellent oral communication, technical writing, and interpersonal skills
Ability to comfortably navigate a diverse, multicultural environment
Excellent organizational skills
Common sense and an unending desire to learn
Senior CFD Engineer
5+ years of relevant industry experience to be considered for this role
2+ years work experience in a formal software development environment
2+ years of project or people management experience
Preferred Skills and Experience

Exceptional CFD engineers usually draw heavily on the following skills and experience:

2+ years of relevant industry or academic experience (e.g., additive manufacturing, propellant management design, slosh analysis, consumer product processing, coating, analysis of complex fluids, etc.)
Experience with FEA or other numerical analysis
Experience with experimental setups and data analysis
Experience with 3D CAD
Programming experience (FORTRAN and Python)
Demonstrated initiative in work projects
EIT certification
Demonstrated ability to distill information into clear requirements
Experience working on software development projects or interfacing with software development teams, especially for engineering analysis software
Knowledge of Agile methods and tools
Benefits

Flow Science offers an exceptional benefits package to full-time employees including medical, dental, vision insurances, life and disability insurances, 401(k) and profit-sharing plans with generous employer matching, and an incentive compensation plan that offers a year-end bonus opportunity up to 30% of base salary.

1 HuffPost listed Santa Fe, NM as one of the top 5 small cities in the US

summary: Executive Order 2021-066 requires all employees with the State of New Mexico to provide either proof of COVID-19 vaccination (including proof of a booster dose…
job_description:
Salary

$20.54 - $35.74 Hourly
$42,719 - $74,331 Annually
This position is a Pay Band 75

Purpose of Position
No job description available
Why does the job exist?
Working with a staff of 2 Librarians and 2 Photo Archivists, the Supervisory Curator is responsible for collections in the Chavez History Library and Palace of the Governors Photo Archive. The Library and Photo Archive are specialized programs within the New Mexico History Museum that are, in general, focused on New Mexico Culture and Southwest History. The position also serves as the photographic curator for the New Mexico History Museum.
How does it get done?
As a manager, this Supervisory Curator provides leadership and technical guidance for all projects and activities within the museum's library and photo archives. Since both programs must contend with a variety of competing demands on staff time and financial resources, the position plays a critical role in planning, setting priorities, and overseeing work assignments. Within this context, specific responsibilities of the position include:


(1) Supervision and professional development of 2 librarians and 2 phot archivists - one of whom is a digital reproduction specialist.

(2) Oversight of management, use, and development and library collections. This ranges from revisions to "Scope of Collection" plans and ensuring environmentally appropriate storage space, to addressing inconsistent documentation, preparation of finding aids, implementation of acquisition strategies, Reponses to research and reference requests, and photo reproduction services.

(3) Development and support of exhibitions and other Interpretive projects including posting of online content. This work is generally done in concert with other museum staff, especially curators and educators.

(4) In Collaboration with other employees in the Library and Photo Archives, manages accounts for program operation and special projects, prepares grant applications, and supports fundraising as led by the museum's Executive Director.


In addition to a supervisory role, the Supervisory Curator is also personally responsible for support of reference and research requests, development of interpretive materials - including exhibitions, articles, and online content, and oversight of the museums transition to a digital infrastructure for data management and public access.
Who are the customers?
Work done by this position is of potential interest to anyone in the general public. In Terms of actual practice, primary customers include scholars and other researchers, museum staff within the Department of Cultural Affairs, and employees of other state agencies. Within the broad framework, the Supervisory Curator is expected to pay particular attention to under served, Native American, and low-income communities and to help them utilize the collections held within the Chavez History Library and palace of the Governors Photo Archive.
Ideal Candidate
(1) A university degree, preferably at the graduate level, with an emphasis in New Mexico History, library science, or the history of photography.

(2) Experience managing large and complex museum collections, special library collections, and or/photo archives.

(3) Experience supervising a staff of professionals, leading teams, and serving the public.

(4) Technical experience developing the digital infrastructure to manage and enhance public access to historic documents and photographs.

(5) Experience producing museum exhibitions and other interpretive projects, including use of digital applications and preparation of articles for public dissemination.
Minimum Qualification
Bachelor's degree in Museum Studies, Museology, Art, Art History, Art Administration, Anthropology, American Studies, Archaeology, Curatorial Studies, History, Humanities, Interdisciplinary Studies, Liberal Arts, Public History, or Paleontology and four (4) years of experience in exhibit development, collections management, curation, creative writing, conducting research in specialty area of a museum, and working with historical concepts. Substitutions Apply. See Substitution Table below.
Substitution Table

These combinations of education and experience qualify you for the position:

 Education Experience Education Experience

1 High School Diploma or Equivalent AND 8 years of experience OR High School Diploma or Equivalent AND 8 years of experience
2 Associate's degree in the field(s) specified in the minimum qualification AND 6 years of experience Associate's degree or higher in any field AND 8 years of experience
3 Bachelor's degree in the field(s) specified in the minimum qualification AND 4 years of experience

4 Master's degree in the field(s) specified in the minimum qualification AND 2 years of experience

5 PhD degree in the field(s) specified in the minimum qualification AND 0 years of experience

Education and years of experience must be related to the purpose of the position.
If Minimum Qualification requires a specific number of "semester hours" in a field (e.g. 6 semester hours in Accounting), applicants MUST have those semester hours in order to meet the minimum qualifications. No substitutions apply for semester hours.

Employment Requirements
No job description available
Working Conditions
Executive Order 2021-066 requires all employees with the State of New Mexico to provide either proof of COVID-19 vaccination (including proof of a booster dose of vaccine by January 17, 2022, or within four weeks of becoming eligible for a booster dose) or proof of a COVID-19 viral test every week.

The Public Health Order (on Vaccination) dated December 2, 2021, requires Congregate Care Facility Workers and Hospital Workers to have received a primary series of vaccination by October 6, 2021, and a booster dose of vaccine by January 17, 2022, or within four weeks of becoming eligible for a booster.

Links to the referenced Executive Order and Public Health Order can be found on the State Personnel Office website homepage: www.spo.state.nm.us

Primarily works in an office setting although some activity takes place within museum galleries and in locations outside museum campus. The work involves extensive use of a personal computer, printer/scanner, and telephone. Some standing, bending, and light lifting is required. The ability to see documents and photographic images, and to handle fragile documents and photographs is essential to the job. Exposure to toxic materials associated with photographs (including nitrate negatives), office supplies, and equipment tis intrinsic to the position and must be managed in accordance with approved safety procedures.

summary:
Directing overall planning and development of strategies to effectively design, develop, test, deploy, and maintain software.
A Bachelor's degree*; and either.
job_description:
The Position
The Information Services Supervisor (ISS) in the IT Applications Division of the Information Systems Department (ISD) coordinates with ISD managers, project managers, developers, system administrators, contractors, and users to procure, implement, maintain, support, enhance, and evaluate the performance of software systems and to ensure compliance with ISD and information technology (IT) industry-accepted standards. Additionally, the ISS serves as a technical lead or project manager in planning, overseeing, and controlling timelines, work assignments, work processes, and deliverables associated with all phases of the software development lifecycle.
The ISS may be responsible for any one of a number of workgroups within the IT Applications Division. The immediate vacancy is in the ColdFusion/PeopleSoft workgroup, responsible for lifecycle activities associated with the specification, design, implementation, maintenance, support, enhancement, and replacement of software systems developed using the ColdFusion language and PeopleSoft technology. Major upcoming projects include the replacement of the District's PeopleSoft financial and human resources information systems and ColdFusion-based work management systems with modern solutions.
Duties include:Planning, organizing, coordinating, assigning, scheduling, directing, and reviewing staff, vendor, consultant, and contractor work.
Directing overall planning and development of strategies to effectively design, develop, test, deploy, and maintain software.Establishing and enforcing standards for work products and work methods in assigned areas of responsibility.Documenting and evaluating staff performance against established standards and recommending corrective action and training as needed.Working productively with technical and non-technical staff and contractors to ensure efficient implementation of cloud services, hardware, software, and system enhancements, and to minimize operational impact to clients. Personally managing unusual or sensitive issues.Maintaining communication with project management and client department representatives to establish scope and schedule of projects, advise on project status and risks, and ensure that concerns are properly addressed.Investigating and recommending solutions to technical situations beyond the scope or skill of subordinate staff.Assisting the division manager in long range planning to meet division goals and participating in ISD process improvement efforts.Preparing and presenting executive summaries of proposed new software systems to ISD managers. Discussing and confirming relative priorities of requested software system implementation or improvement work with ISD managers, project managers, and clients. Recommending changes in priorities, sequencing of tasks, and technical approaches to achieve desired results.Preparing specifications for contracted products and services. Evaluating contract bids and recommending awards. Monitoring vendor performance and enforcing contract terms and conditions.
Knowledge of:Current industry-standard IT principles and practices.Processes, services, and related terminology applicable to common business systems or internal technical ISD support groups as found in a large-scale public water and wastewater utility.Planning, implementation, testing, documentation, and support procedures for new software, applications, and systems.Supervisory principles and practices.
Ability to:Apply supervisory, project management, and technical knowledge to meet project and operational requirements and deadlines.Adjust work priorities, assignments, and schedules in response to competing priorities, changing conditions, and new information.Communicate and consult with a wide variety of departmental representatives on a diverse set of business needs and priorities.Coach, mentor, and train assigned staff in customer service and IT principles and practices.Evaluate individual staff and overall work unit performance, taking corrective action as needed.Research and apply advances in IT principles, practices, products, and services to provide solutions that meet technical and business requirements.
The most competitive candidates for this position will demonstrate:Technical lead or project management experience on complex software projects using modern technologies and practices.Experience performing troubleshooting and providing support for mission-critical software systems.Experience working productively in a variety of business and technical domains.Experience working calmly and rationally in stressful situations.Continuous learning and self-improvement as an IT professional.Excellent written and oral communication skills.
This is not a remote work only position and candidates must be prepared to work 5 days per week on-site at the District's Administration Building located in downtown Oakland, CA. A hybrid telecommute and on-site work arrangement is currently under consideration for possible future authorization.
The monthly salary ranges from $12,413, increasing to $13,034, $13,686, and $14,370 after 6, 18, and 30 months, respectively.
EBMUD is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, gender, gender identity (including transgender status), gender expression, marital or registered domestic partnership status, age for individuals age forty or older, national origin, ancestry, disability (mental or physical), medical condition (cancer and genetic characteristics), genetic information, sexual orientation, military and veterans status, family or medical leave status, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation or related medical condition), pregnancy disability leave status, domestic violence victim status, political affiliation, and other categories protected by federal, state and/or local laws.
Requirements
1. A Bachelor's degree*; and either
2a. As required by the position vacancy, one year of EBMUD experience as a Senior Software Engineer, Senior IT Engineer, Network Analyst III; or two years of EBMUD experience as a Network Analyst II; or
2b. Four years of experience** in one or a combination of the following subject areas as required by the position vacancy such as: systems analysis, software development, and computer programming; database administration; systems programming; IT project management; cloud-based computing services; IT security; geographic information systems; personal computer hardware installation and repair; and/or software installation and customization in a network environment involving data communications. Additional demonstrated use and experience in specific programming languages or IT disciplines may be required depending on the assignment. At least one year of experience will have included some project lead responsibility.
3. Physical characteristics to perform the critical and important duties of the job.
4. Willingness to work overtime as needed.
Additional years of experience (beyond the minimum requirement) may be substituted for the education on a year for year basis, only if the experience is at the level of the job for which the applicant is applying. (i.e., Four additional years of experience, at the level of the Information Services Supervisor classification, will be considered equivalent to a bachelor’s degree).
**A graduate level degree in a directly related field may be substituted for one year of experience, but not for the year of required project lead responsibility.
Please note: EBMUD requires all employees to provide written proof of vaccination. Those employees with sincerely held religious beliefs or valid medical reasons, as determined by EBMUD, will be exempt from vaccination requirements.*Please contact EBMUD Human Resources for additional questions.
Equivalent combinations of education and experience may be considered. To be considered under the “equivalent combination of education and experience” provision, it is your responsibility to include in your application materials written evidence of employment performed at the level of the typical duties of this position and/or coursework in subject areas directly related to this position. For more information, see our FAQ page at http://www.ebmud.com/jobs/job-resources/job-faqs-frequently-asked-questions/.
The Selection Process
1. Submit a completed EBMUD application and the required supplemental question responses online at www.ebmud.com by 4:30 p.m., Friday, February 11, 2022. Only application materials submitted online during the filing period will be accepted.
2. Candidates must achieve a passing score on each test part in order to advance to the next step in the selection process.
3. All qualified applications and supplemental responses will be competitively evaluated, with those candidates receiving a passing score to be invited to a panel interview tentatively scheduled in March 2022.
4. Successful candidates will be placed on the hiring list, based on rank, for further consideration to fill the current regular vacancy, as well as others occurring over the next 12 to 24 months.
5. The probation period for this position is 12 months. For those holding civil service status the probation period is 6 months.
6. All employment offers are conditional, pending the results of a Live Scan background screening. All selected finalists must participate in the Live Scan background screening process to remain in consideration for EBMUD employment.
Supplemental Information
As the first step in the selection process, responses to the supplemental questions must be submitted online with the regular EBMUD application. Please provide thorough, accurate descriptions of assignments you have personally performed. Should you respond with comments such as “see application” or “see resume” instead of addressing the questions directly, your application may not be considered.
Our excellent benefits package includes: Eligibility for annual merit-based bonus pay program; 12 days paid vacation; 15 holidays; 7 days paid administrative leave; 13 days paid sick leave; Family health insurance (choice of Kaiser fully paid or Sutter Health Plus or Anthem Blue Cross 85% paid); Fully paid family dental and vision care plans; life insurance; long-term disability insurance; EBMUD Retirement Plan (reciprocal with CalPERS); $915/yr. contributed to flexible spending account or cash; $145/mo. public transit subsidy; 401(k), 401(a) and 457(b) tax-deferred retirement plans; Roth 401(k); $3,500/yr. tuition reimbursement; And opportunities for professional growth including training and career development.

summary: The Environmental Engineer Supervisor of the Floodplain Management Section within the Water Resources Branch is a professional level position requiring a…
job_description:
Advertisement Closes
2/18/2022 (7:00 PM EST)
22-01250
Environmental Engineer Supervisor
Pay Grade
17
Salary
$5,178.72 - $6,254.30 Monthly
Employment Type
EXECUTIVE BRANCH | FULL TIME, INELIGIBLE FOR OVERTIME PAY | 18A | 37.5 HR/WK
Hiring Agency
Energy & Environment Cabinet | Dept for Environmental Protection
Location
300 Sower Blvd
Frankfort, KY 40601 USA

The agency may authorize the selected applicant to telecommute. The agency may terminate or modify the telecommuting arrangement at any time.
Description
The Kentucky Energy and Environment Cabinet presents an opportunity for you to make a difference in the protecting the waters of Kentucky in a fast paced, exciting, and collaborative environment. The Department for Environmental Protection, Division of Water’s mission is to manage, protect and enhance the quality and quantity of the Commonwealth’s water resources for present and future generations through voluntary, regulatory and educational programs.


Currently the Division of Water seeks a candidate that has experience in state and federal floodplain management regulations, floodplain development activities, hydraulic modeling, GIS capabilities, and can work with an experienced engineering staff to develop effective team communication and section operating procedures.


The Environmental Engineer Supervisor of the Floodplain Management Section within the Water Resources Branch is a professional level position requiring a Professional Engineering license that allows the incumbent to work across organizational lines, with the public and with the regulated community providing technical, scientific assistance on permitting floodplain development activities in compliance with state and federal regulations.


Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
Promotes and implements sound floodplain management activities to reduce the risk of current and future flooding by ensuring that proposed development is reasonably safe from flooding.
Reviews and approves engineering documents prepared by staff and permit applicants. Provides technical assistance regarding environmental engineering statutes and regulations related to floodplain development permit applications and reviews permitting documents prior to permit issuance.
Supervises employees in the section including but not limited to approving/denying leave requests, approving timesheets, providing coaching to employees, completing employee evaluations, etc.
Assists with the implementation of the National Floodplain Insurance Program (NFIP).
Represents the Division at meetings and conferences as it relates to floodplain management programs.
Acts as an expert witness at hearings regarding these programs.
The Division of Water offers flexibility in work schedules, responsibilities both in and away from the office, an opportunity to network with a wide range of professionals within and outside the agency. If you are interested in a rewarding career with the Division of Water we would love to review your application.
Minimum Requirements
EDUCATION: See Special Requirements.

EXPERIENCE, TRAINING, OR SKILLS: Must have two years of engineering experience in addition to that required for licensure.

Substitute EDUCATION for EXPERIENCE: A master's degree in engineering will substitute for one year of the required experience. Graduate work in engineering beyond a master's degree will substitute for the required experience on a year-for-year basis.

Substitute EXPERIENCE for EDUCATION: NONE

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS (AGE, LICENSURE, REGULATION, ETC.): Must be licensed as a professional engineer by the State Board of Licensure for Professional Engineers and Land Surveyors. http:// http://kyboels.ky.gov/ Must maintain any required licensure(s), certification(s), or other credentials for the length of employment in this classification. Employing agency is responsible for ensuring employee possesses and maintains required licensure(s), certification(s) or other credentials.
Working Conditions
Work is performed in the office and in the field. Will be exposed to risks inherent to construction sites.
Probationary Period
This job has an initial and promotional probationary period of 6 months, except as provided in KRS 18A.111.
If you have questions about this advertisement, please contact Shawn Hokanson at shawn.hokanson@ky.gov or 502-782-6977.
An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D

Overview
Position overview:
You may know us for our delicious cheesecakes…and for being recognized by Fortune Magazine as one of the “100 Best Companies to Work For®(8 years in a row!. What you may not know is at The Cheesecake Factory Bakery, our staff members are our highest quality ingredient.
The Accounts Payable Supervisor will play an integral part in all aspects of The Cheesecake Factory Bakery Accounts Payable functions. The position oversees the full cycle of accounts payable including the daily activities of the AP Technicians.
You’ll thrive in this position if you are:
Adaptable: you’re at ease in a fast-paced environment, and you're able to stay nimble and change direction when priorities shift.
Driven by results: you're conscientious and persistent about delivering timely, high quality deliverables. You are never satisfied with your latest accomplishment and are always focused on hitting your next goal.
Exhaustively meticulous: you have an unrelenting attention to detail, leaving nothing to chance while understanding what deserves your immediate attention and what can wait.

Responsibilities

Match incoming receipts, invoices, and purchase orders together for entering into the Accounts Payable system ensuring a three-way match.
Responsible for accurate and timely review of transactions processed by the AP Technicians.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Our bakery division operates two facilities that produce delicious cheesecakes and other baked products for our restaurants, international licensees and third-party bakery customers. Responsible for the acceptable performance of grounds maintenance in such areas as mowing, edging, fertilizing, aerifying, renovating, and installing lawns. Directs all routine care of cultivated and surfaced areas. Inspects, and monitors ground area in his/her district. Interacts on a regular basis with clients, maintaining a positive and proactive relationship to insure that grounds are being properly maintained at a satisfactory level. Hire, train, evaluate and take disciplinary actions necessary on employees. Plan short/long range goals and objectives, costs analysis, and inventory control. Instruct and supervise groundskeepers in proper usage, care and maintenance of tools and equipment.

100

Records

Preferred

Required

Required

Required

Required

At ChemTreat, we understand and respect the awe-inspiring power of water to impact industries, and to sustain and enhance lives. Our 2,000 associates across North and South America maximize this power for our customers—from power producers to food and beverage companies to the automotive industry.

Our “whatever-it-takes” mindset allows us to turn our 50 years of experience and innovative thinking into meaningful outcomes for our customers—and rewarding careers for our people.

Job Summary:
The Billing Manager supports daily accounts receivable functions while empowering a team of 6-10 associates and striving to uncover enhanced operational efficiencies. In addition, prepares audits and posts auto and manual invoices as well as working with corporate teams to resolve billing discrepancies. This role is also a critical participant in the end of month close process. We are a fast paced organization and seeking an excellent leader to take our team to the next level!

Foster a culture of teamwork and constant improvement.

Education & experience
Bachelor’s degree required in Accounting/Finance preferred or equivalent experience
5+ years of experience in Billing and Collections

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.
